elements.name: IsRefEssential
elements.description: - returns whether the referenced actor is essential

elements.name: SetRefEssential
elements.description: - sets the calling ref to be essential or not

elements.name: GetActorLightAmount
elements.description: - returns a float describing the amount of light falling on an actor, or 100 if the actor is not in high/medium-high process.

elements.name: CanCorpseCheck
elements.description: - returns 1 if the Can Corpse Check flag is set on the actor

elements.name: SetCanCorpseCheck
elements.description: - changes the Can Corpse Check flag on the actor

elements.name: GetActorMinLevel
elements.description: - returns the minimum level of the actor if the PC Level Offset flag is set

elements.name: GetActorMaxLevel
elements.description: - returns the maximum level of the actor if the PC Level Offset flag is set

elements.name: GetNumFactions
elements.description: - returns the number of factions to which the actor belongs

elements.name: GetNthFaction
elements.description: - returns the nth faction to which the actor belongs

elements.name: GetActorSoulLevel
elements.description: - returns the soul level of any actor. If an NPC it returns Grand, otherwise if a creature it returns the creature's soul level.

elements.name: HasLowLevelProcessing
elements.description: - returns 1 if the actor has low level processing enabled

elements.name: HasNoPersuasion
elements.description: - returns 1 if the No Persuasion flag is set on the actor

elements.name: SetNoPersuasion
elements.description: - changes the No Persuasion flag on the actor

elements.name: IsActorRespawning
elements.description: - returns 1 if the Respawn flag is set on the actor

elements.name: IsPCLevelOffset
elements.description: - returns 1 if the actor's level is calculated relative to the player's level

elements.name: GetActorBaseLevel
elements.description: - returns the level of the base actor. In the editor, for creatures this is the "Level Offset" field; for NPCs it is the "Level" field. For either, the meaning of the return value depends on whether or not the PC Level Offset flag is set for the base actor.

elements.name: IsSummonable
elements.description: - returns 1 if the Summonable flag is set on the actor

elements.name: SetSummonable
elements.description: - changes the Summonable flag on the actor

elements.name: SetActorRespawns
elements.description: - changes the Respawn flag on the actor

elements.name: SetFemale
elements.description: - changes the Female flag on the actor. Changes are saved but may not be immediately visible.

elements.name: SetLowLevelProcessing
elements.description: - turns low level processing on or off for the actor. Note that this sets the No Low Level Processing flag to the opposite of the passed value.

elements.name: SetPCLevelOffset
elements.description: - changes the PC Level Offset flag on the actor, and optionally specifies the minimum andmaximum levels. If minLevel or maxLevel is omitted or passed as -1, the existing value will be retained.

elements.name: GetNumPackages
elements.description: - returns the number of AI packages in the actor's package list

elements.name: GetNthPackage
elements.description: - returns the Nth AI package in the NPC's package list, in the order in which they were added in the editor.

elements.name: GetSpellEffectiveness
elements.description: - returns the actor's spell effectiveness based on the armor he or she has equipped as a floating point value from 0 to 1.0. The return value is always 1.0 for creatures and NPCs other than the player. When calledon the player, this command returns the player's base spell effectiveness as calculated by the game plus any script modifier applied by ModPCSpellEffectiveness.

elements.name: CanCastPower
elements.description: - returns false if the calling actor has already used the specified greater power within the last 24 hours. This command does not check for the presence of the greater power in the actor's spellbook.

elements.name: SetCanCastPower
elements.description: - indicates whether the calling actor can cast the specified greater power. Passing 1 allows the actor to cast the power even if he has already used it within the past 24 hours. Passing 0 disallows the actor from casting the spell for the next 24 hours, unless the actor has already cast the power, in which case the power will become usable as normal 24 hours after the last casting.

elements.name: SetPowerTimer
elements.description: - sets the amount of time that must pass until the calling actor can cast the specified power. The time is a float representing the number of real-time seconds until the power becomes usable. When an actor uses a power, the game calculates the 24-hour timer as

elements.name: GetUsedPowers
elements.description: - returns an Array containing information about all greater powers which the calling actor has used. This includes powers cast by the actor within the last 24 hours as well as any powers flagged as used by SetCanCastPower and SetPowerTimer. The return value is an Array of StringMaps:

elements.name: HasSpell
elements.description: - returns whether the actor has the specified spell

elements.name: IsDiseased
elements.description: - returns whether the actor has a disease

elements.name: RemoveBaseSpell
elements.description: - the game's RemoveSpell removes a spell from a base actor but must be called on a reference. This command does the same thing as RemoveSpell but takes a base object as an argument, returning 1 if the spell was removed.

elements.name: GetLeveledSpells
elements.description: - returns an Array containing all of the leveled spells in the base actor's spell list.

elements.name: GetActorPackages
elements.description: - returns an Array containing the AI packages defined in the base actor's package list, in the order in which they are listed in the editor.

elements.name: GetCurrentPackage
elements.description: - returns the actor ref's currently executing package

elements.name: GetCurrentPackageProcedure
elements.description: - returns the name of the

elements.name: GetCurrentEditorPackage
elements.description: - returns the actor ref's executing non-dynamic package

elements.name: EquipItem2
elements.description: - duplicates the behavior of the vanilla

elements.name: EquipItem2NS
elements.description: - behaves identically to

elements.name: GetSpecialAnims
elements.description: - returns an Array containing the filenames of any special animations for the actor. Animations for creatures, and those in the SpecialAnims folder for NPCs, can be toggled on and off in the actor's animation list in the editor.

elements.name: ToggleSpecialAnim
elements.description: - adds or removes an animation from the base actor's animation list. For creatures, the animations must appear in the creature's model folder; for NPCs they must be located in the Special Anims folder. Changes made using this command have no effect on the animations of reference's to the base actor which are currently in middle-high or high process.

elements.name: GetGroundSurfaceMaterial
elements.description: - returns the

elements.name: GetFactions
elements.description: - returns an array containing the factions the calling ref or base actor is a member of.

elements.name: GetActorSwimBreath
elements.description: - returns the calling high process actor's swimming breath level in seconds.

elements.name: SetActorSwimBreath
elements.description: - sets the calling high process actor's swimming breath level.

elements.name: GetActorMaxSwimBreath
elements.description: - returns the calling high process actor's maximum swimming breath level  in seconds.

elements.name: SetActorMaxSwimBreath
elements.description: - sets the calling high process actor's maximum swimming breath level. Overrides are automatically cleared when the actor leaves the high process AI processing band.

elements.name: OverrideActorSwimBreath
elements.description: - overrides the

elements.name: GetAVMod
elements.description: - returns one of the calling actor's modifiers for the specified actor value. The modifier is specified as a string: "script" refers to the script (or "offset") modifier applied by the

elements.name: SetAVMod
elements.description: - sets the value of one of the calling actor's modifiers for the specified actor value. The modifier is specified as a string: "script" refers to the script (or "offset") modifier applied by the

elements.name: ModAVMod
elements.description: - modifies the value of one of the calling actor's modifiers for the specified actor value by the specified amount. The modifier is specified as a string: "script" refers to the script (or "offset") modifier applied by the

elements.name: GetMaxAV
elements.description: - returns the maximum possible value of the specified actor value for the calling actor.

elements.name: GetAVForBaseActor
elements.description: - returns the value of the specified actor value as defined for the base actor. If the second argument is omitted, the base object for the calling actor is used. Note that not all actor values are defined for base actors, in which case this command returns 0.

elements.name: GetActorValueC
elements.description: - returns the actor value specified by the actor value code

elements.name: ModActorValueC
elements.description: - modifies the actor value without changing the base value. Acts like a spell: a negative number reduces the value which can be restored and a positive value restores values without exceeding the maximum of the stat.

elements.name: SetActorValueC
elements.description: - sets the actor value specified by the actor value code

elements.name: ModActorValue2
elements.description: - modifies the current value without changing the base value. Acts like a spell: a negative number reduces the value which can be restored and a positive value restores values without exceeding the maximum of the stat.

elements.name: GetLuckModifiedSkill
elements.description: - the game applies a modifier to all skills based on an actor's luck attribute. This command takes an actual skill value and a luck attribute value and calculates the effective level of the skill after the luck modifier has been applied. The third parameter can be used to return an uncapped value - The result is capped at 100 by default.

elements.name: GetAVSkillMasteryLevel
elements.description: - returns the current mastery level of an actor's skill. The mastery level is an integer from 0 (Novice) to 4 (Master).

elements.name: GetAVSkillMasteryLevelC
elements.description: - alternate version of GetAVSkillMasteryLevel taking an actor value for the skill.

elements.name: GetAttackDamage
elements.description: - returns the base attack damage

elements.name: SetAttackDamage
elements.description: - sets the base attack damage

elements.name: ModAttackDamage
elements.description: - modifies the base attack damage up or down

elements.name: GetWeaponSpeed
elements.description: - returns the weapon speed

elements.name: SetWeaponSpeed
elements.description: - sets the weapon speed

elements.name: ModWeaponSpeed
elements.description: - modifies the weapon speed up or down

elements.name: GetIgnoresResistance
elements.description: - returns whether the object ignores normal damage resistance

elements.name: SetIgnoresResistance
elements.description: - sets whether the object ignores normal damage resistance

elements.name: GetOpenSound
elements.description: - Returns the "open" sound

elements.name: GetCloseSound
elements.description: - Returns the "close" sound

elements.name: GetLoopSound
elements.description: - Returns the looping sound

elements.name: SetOpenSound
elements.description: - Sets the "open" sound

elements.name: SetCloseSound
elements.description: - Sets the "close" sound

elements.name: SetLoopSound
elements.description: - Sets the looping sound

elements.name: GetObjectHealth
elements.description: - returns the base object health

elements.name: SetObjectHealth
elements.description: - sets the base object health

elements.name: ModObjectHealth
elements.description: - modifies the base object health up or down

elements.name: GetCurrentHealth
elements.description: - returns the current health of the calling reference

elements.name: SetCurrentHealth
elements.description: - sets the current health of the calling reference

elements.name: GetEquippedCurrentHealth
elements.description: -  gets the current health of the object in the specified equipment slot

elements.name: SetEquippedCurrentHealth
elements.description: - sets the current health of the object in the specified equipment slot

elements.name: ModEquippedCurrentHealth
elements.description: - modifies the current health of the object in the specified equipment slot up or down

elements.name: GetClass
elements.description: - returns the class of the NPC

elements.name: GetClassAttribute
elements.description: - returns the Nth attribute of the class. If called on a reference it will attempt to find the class from that referenced NPC and use that. If a class FormID is passed, that takes precedence.

elements.name: GetClassSkill
elements.description: - returns the Nth skill of the class. If called on a reference it will attempt to find the class from that referenced NPC and use that. If a class FormID is passed, that takes precedence.

elements.name: GetClassSpecialization
elements.description: - returns the class specialization. If called on a reference it will attempt to find the class from that referenced NPC and use that. If a class FormID is passed, that takes precedence.

elements.name: IsClassSkill
elements.description: - returns whether the passed skill is a skill of the class. If called on a reference it will attempt to find the class from that referenced NPC and use that. If a class FormID is passed, that takes precedence.

elements.name: IsMajorRef
elements.description: - returns whether the passed skill is a skill of the class of the called on a reference.

elements.name: IsClassSkillC
elements.description: - alternate version of IsClassSkill taking a skill code instead of the name of a skill.

elements.name: IsClassAttribute
elements.description: - returns whether the passed attribute is an attribute of the class. If called on a reference it will attempt to find the class from that referenced NPC and use that. If a class FormID is passed, that takes precedence. (available in v0011)

elements.name: IsClassAttributeC
elements.description: - alternate version of

elements.name: GetClassSkills
elements.description: - returns an Array containing the seven major skills associated with the class. If the parameter is omitted, the class of the calling NPC is used.

elements.name: SetClassSkills
elements.description: - accepts an Array of seven different skill codes and sets them as the class's major skills. If fewer or more than seven skills are found in the array or duplicate skills are found, the function will return zero with no changes made to the class. If the class argument is omitted, the calling NPC's class is used.

elements.name: SetClassSkills2
elements.description: - Identical to SetClassSkills, except it allows duplicate skills.

elements.name: SetClassSpecialization
elements.description: - sets the class specialization. If the class argument is omitted thecalling NPC's class is used.

elements.name: SetClassAttribute
elements.description: - sets one of the two favored attributes for the class. Both class attributes must be unique. If the class argument is omitted the calling NPC's class is used.

elements.name: SetClassAttributeC
elements.description: - as SetClassAttribute but takes an actor value code instead of an actor value string.

elements.name: GetNumItems
elements.description: - returns the number of different object types in the container or actor's inventory.

elements.name: GetInventoryObject
elements.description: - returns the objectID of the Nth item type in the container or actor's inventory

elements.name: IsContainer
elements.description: - returns whether the reference or passed objectID is a container.

elements.name: GetContainerRespawns
elements.description: - returns whether the container's contents repawn.

elements.name: SetContainerRespawns
elements.description: - sets whether the container's contents respawn.

elements.name: GetItems
elements.description: - returns an Array containing all of the items in a container's or actor's inventory. Up to 10 form types may be passed in to restrict the returned items to only include items matching those type(s).

elements.name: GetBaseItems
elements.description: - returns an Array of StringMaps containing the items present in a base container or actor's inventory and the quantity of each. These are the items added to the base object in the editor and may include leveled items. Some, all, or none of the items may be present in the inventory of a specific reference to the base object. Each element of the returned Array is a StringMap with two elements:

elements.name: GetDescription
elements.description: - returns the text of the description for the object. In the case of skills, an optional second parameter indicates the skill rank (0-3); if omitted, the skill's general description is returned.

elements.name: SetDescription
elements.description: - modifies the text of a TESDescription (e.g. book, class, skill, skill level, etc). The modified description will be used for the remainder of the game session. To modify the text displayed when achieving a new level of mastery (Apprentice, Journeyman, etc) in a skill, pass the skill as the second argument and a skill level as the third, where skill level ranges from 0 (Apprentice) to 3 (Master)

elements.name: IsFood
elements.description: - returns whether the object is considered to be food

elements.name: SetIsFood
elements.description: - sets whether the object is considered to be food

elements.name: GetEnchantment
elements.description: - returns the specific enchantment on the object

elements.name: SetEnchantment
elements.description: - sets the specific enchantment on the object and returns any previous enchantment

elements.name: RemoveEnchantment
elements.description: - removes the enchantment from the object and returns any previous enchantment

elements.name: GetObjectCharge
elements.description: - returns the max charge of the object

elements.name: SetObjectCharge
elements.description: - sets the max charge of the object

elements.name: ModObjectCharge
elements.description: - modifies the max charge of the object up or down

elements.name: GetCurrentCharge
elements.description: - returns the current charge of the calling reference

elements.name: GetEquippedCurrentCharge
elements.description: - returns the current charge of the object in the specified slot

elements.name: SetEquippedCurrentCharge
elements.description: - sets the current charge of the object in the specified slot

elements.name: ModEquippedCurrentCharge
elements.description: - modifies the current charge of the object in the specified slot up or down

elements.name: SetCurrentCharge
elements.description: - sets the current charge of the calling reference if it is less than or equal to the maximum charge

elements.name: ModCurrentCharge
elements.description: - modifies the current charge of the calling reference by the specified amount. Will not modify the charge past its maximum or below zero.

elements.name: GetEquipmentSlot
elements.description: - returns the equipment slot or slots taken by the object

elements.name: SetEquipmentSlot
elements.description: - sets the equipment slot or slots taken by the object.

elements.name: EquipMe
elements.description: - when called on an object in an actor's inventory, attempts to equip the object on the actor and runs the object's

elements.name: UnequipMe
elements.description: - when called on an object in an actor's inventory, attempts to unequip the object on the actor and runs the object's

elements.name: GetBaseObject
elements.description: - returns the base object of the reference.

elements.name: GetObjectType
elements.description: - returns a type code for each type of object.

elements.name: IsWeapon
elements.description: - returns whether the object is a weapon.

elements.name: IsAmmo
elements.description: - returns whether the object is ammunition.

elements.name: IsArmor
elements.description: - returns whether the object is armor.

elements.name: IsBook
elements.description: - returns whether the object is a book.

elements.name: IsClothing
elements.description: - returns whether the object is clothing.

elements.name: IsIngredient
elements.description: - returns whether the object is an ingredient.

elements.name: IsKey
elements.description: - returns whether the object is a key.

elements.name: IsAlchemyItem
elements.description: - returns whether the object is an alchemy item (potion).

elements.name: IsApparatus
elements.description: - returns whether the object is an alchemy apparatus.

elements.name: IsSoulGem
elements.description: - returns whether the object is a soul gem.

elements.name: IsSigilStone
elements.description: - returns whether the object is a sigil stone.

elements.name: IsMiscItem
elements.description: - returns whether the object is a miscellaneous item.

elements.name: IsLight
elements.description: - returns whether the object is a light source.

elements.name: IsFlora
elements.description: - returns 1 if the object is a harvestable plant.

elements.name: GetWeight
elements.description: - returns the weight of the type.

elements.name: SetWeight
elements.description: - sets the weight of the type.

elements.name: ModWeight
elements.description: - modifies the weight of the type up or down.

elements.name: GetGoldValue
elements.description: - returns the base gold value of the type.

elements.name: GetFullGoldValue
elements.description: - returns the full gold value of an item, including the value added by enchantments.

elements.name: SetGoldValue
elements.description: - sets the base gold value of the type.

elements.name: ModGoldValue
elements.description: - modifies the base gold value of the type up or down.

elements.name: IsQuestItem
elements.description: - returns whether the type is a quest item.

elements.name: SetQuestItem
elements.description: - sets whether the type is a quest item.

elements.name: SetCurrentSoulLevel
elements.description: - sets the current soul level of the calling soulgem reference.

elements.name: GetOpenKey
elements.description: - returns the key used to unlock the calling reference.

elements.name: SetOpenKey
elements.description: - sets the key used to unlock the reference to the specified key.

elements.name: GetMagicItemType
elements.description: - returns the magic item type.

elements.name: GetMagicItemEffectCount
elements.description: -  returns the number of magic effect items.

elements.name: MagicItemHasEffect
elements.description: - returns whether the magic item has an effect item with the specifed effect. Uses the 4 letter codes for the magic effects listed in the CS. Uses an optional actor value name for use with effects like fortify skill and fortify attribute.

elements.name: MagicItemHasEffectCode
elements.description: - returns whether the magic item has an effect item with the specified effect code. Uses a long value returned from

elements.name: MagicItemHasEffectCount
elements.description: - returns the count of the specified effects on the magic item. Has an optional actorValue name for use with effects like fortify skill and fortify attribute.

elements.name: MagicItemHasEffectCountCode
elements.description: -  returns the count of effects with the specified effect code on the magic item. Uses a long value returned from

elements.name: GetNthEffectItemCode
elements.description: - returns the magic effect code of the specified effect item.

elements.name: GetNthEffectItemMagnitude
elements.description: - returns the magnitude of the specified effect item.

elements.name: SetNthEffectItemMagnitude
elements.description: - sets the magnitude of the specified effect item.

elements.name: ModNthEffectItemMagnitude
elements.description: - modifies the magnitude of the specified effect item up or down.

elements.name: GetNthEffectItemArea
elements.description: - returns the area of the specified effect item.

elements.name: SetNthEffectItemArea
elements.description: - sets the area of the specified effect item.

elements.name: ModNthEffectItemArea
elements.description: - modifies the effect area of the specified effect item up or down.

elements.name: GetNthEffectItemDuration
elements.description: - returns the duration of the specified effect item.

elements.name: SetNthEffectItemDuration
elements.description: - sets the duration of the specified effect item.

elements.name: ModNthEffectItemDuration
elements.description: - modifies the duration of the specified effect item up or down.

elements.name: GetNthEffectItemRange
elements.description: - gets the range of the specified effect item.

elements.name: SetNthEffectItemRange
elements.description: - sets the range of the specified effect item.

elements.name: GetNthEffectItemActorValue
elements.description: - gets the actor value of the specified effect item.

elements.name: SetNthEffectItemActorValue
elements.description: - sets the actor value of the specified effect item.

elements.name: SetNthEffectItemActorValueC
elements.description: - sets the actor value of the specified effect item.

elements.name: RemoveNthEffectItem
elements.description: - removesthe specified effect item.

elements.name: RemoveAllEffectItems
elements.description: - removes all effect items from the magic item.

elements.name: CopyNthEffectItem
elements.description: - copies the specified effect item from one magic item to another.

elements.name: CopyAllEffectItems
elements.description: - copies all effect items from one magic item to another.

elements.name: AddEffectItem
elements.description: - adds a basic, empty EffectItem of the specified MagicEffect to the magic item.

elements.name: AddFullEffectItem
elements.description: - adds a fully defined EffectItem to the magic item with the specified MagicEffect, magnitude, area, duration and range.
example: (index:int) AddFullEffectItem nuEffect:chars magnitude:int area:int duration:int range:int magicItem:ref
(index:int) AddFullEffectItemC nuEffectCode:int magnitude:int area:int duration:int range:int magicItem:ref

elements.name: IsMagicItemAutoCalc
elements.description: - returns 1 if the MagicItem determines magicka cost by autocalculation. Now works on all Magic Items (Spells, Alchemy, Ingredients, Enchantments).

elements.name: SetMagicItemAutoCalc
elements.description: - sets whether the Magic Item determines cost by autocalculation. Currently works for Spells, AlchemyItems, Ingredients and Enchantments.

elements.name: IsNthEffectItemScripted
elements.description: - returns whether the specified effect item is scripted.

elements.name: GetNthEffectItemScript
elements.description: - returns the refID of the script associated with the specified scripted effect.

elements.name: SetNthEffectItemScript
elements.description: - sets the script for the specified scripted effect item. Note that the CS doesn't have a variable type for a script, so you must assign the script editor id to a ref variable to use this function.

elements.name: GetNthEffectItemScriptVisualEffect
elements.description: - returns the magic effect code for the scripted effect item's visual effect.

elements.name: SetNthEffectItemScriptVisualEffect
elements.description: - sets the scrited effect item's visual effect.

elements.name: GetNthEffectItemScriptSchool
elements.description: - returns the school of the scripted effect item.

elements.name: SetNthEffectItemScriptSchool
elements.description: - sets the school of the scripted effect item.

elements.name: IsNthEffectItemScriptHostile
elements.description: - returns whether the scripted effect is hostile.

elements.name: SetNthEffectItemScriptHostile
elements.description: - sets whether the scripted effect is hostile.

elements.name: GetNthEffectItemScriptName
elements.description: - returns the name of the nth effect item, provided that effect item is a script effect.

elements.name: SetNthEffectItemScriptName
elements.description: - sets the name of the scripted effect.

elements.name: SetNthEffectItemScriptNameEX
elements.description: - sets the name of the scripted effect.

elements.name: ModNthEffectItemScriptName
elements.description: - modifies the name of the scripted effect. The

elements.name: MagicItemHasEffectItemScript
elements.description: - returns 1 if the magic effect has a scripted item with the specified script.

elements.name: GetNthEffectItemName
elements.description: - returns the name of the specified active effect, i.e. "Fortify Strength".

elements.name: GetNthEffectItem
elements.description: - returns a StringMap fully describing the specified effect item. The StringMap has the following key-value pairs:

elements.name: GetActiveEffectCount
elements.description: - returns the number of ActiveEffects on the target

elements.name: GetNthActiveEffectCode
elements.description: - returns the effect of the Nth ActiveEffect on the target

elements.name: GetNthActiveEffectMagnitude
elements.description: - returns the magnitude of the Nth ActiveEffect on the target

elements.name: GetNthActiveEffectDuration
elements.description: - returns the total duration of the Nth ActiveEffect on the target

elements.name: GetNthActiveEffectTimeElapsed
elements.description: - returns the time that the Nth ActiveEffect has been applied to the target

elements.name: GetNthActiveEffectMagicItem
elements.description: - returns the magic item which applied theNth ActiveEffect to the target

elements.name: GetNthActiveEffectCaster
elements.description: - return the caster of the Nth ActiveEffect on the target

elements.name: GetNthActiveEffectData
elements.description: - return the data of the NthActiveEffect on the target

elements.name: GetNthActiveEffectMagicItemIndex
elements.description: - returns the index on its magic item of the Nth ActiveEffect on the target

elements.name: GetNthActiveEffectEnchantObject
elements.description: - returns the equipped enchanted object, if any, responsible for the specified active effect

elements.name: SetNthActiveEffectMagnitude
elements.description: - sets the magnitude of the corresponding ActiveEffect

elements.name: ModNthActiveEffectMagnitude
elements.description: - modifies the magnitude of the corresponding ActiveEffect

elements.name: GetTotalActiveEffectMagnitude
elements.description: - returns the total magnitude of all ActiveEffects with a given code on the target

elements.name: GetTotalAENonAbilityMagnitude
elements.description: - returns the total magnitude of all non-ability ActiveEffects with a given code on the target

elements.name: GetTotalAEAbilityMagnitude
elements.description: - returns the total magnitude of all ability ActiveEffects with a given code on the target

elements.name: GetTotalAESpellMagnitude
elements.description: - returns the total magniude of all spell ActiveEffects with a given code on the target

elements.name: GetTotalAEDiseaseMagnitude
elements.description: - returns the total magnitude of all disease ActiveEffects with a given code on the target.

elements.name: GetTotalAELesserPowerMagnitude
elements.description: - returns the total magnitude of all lesser power ActiveEffects with a given code on the target

elements.name: GetTotalAEPowerMagnitude
elements.description: - retuns the total magnidue of all greater power ActiveEffects with a given code on the target

elements.name: GetTotalAEAllSpellsMagnitude
elements.description: - returns the total magnitude of all spells (Spell, Ability, Disease, Lesser Power, Power) with a given code on the target.

elements.name: GetTotalAEEnchantmentMagnitude
elements.description: - retuns the total magnitude of all enchantments with a given code on the target.

elements.name: GetTotalAEAlchemyMagnitude
elements.description: - returns the total magnitude of all potions with a given code on the target.

elements.name: GetScriptActiveEffectIndex
elements.description: - returns the index of the corresponding ActiveEffect for the running script effect. Prior to OBSE 0019, this command returned 0 if the script effect could not be found, and could not distinguish between multiple instances of the same script effect. As of 0019, the command returns -1 on failure, and otherwise returns the index corresponding to the unique active effect associated with the calling script.

elements.name: DispelNthActiveEffect
elements.description: - dispels the effects of the specified active effect and removes it from the actor's active effect list. Note that the effect will not be removed until the next gamemode frame, so the indexes into an actor's effect list do not change immediately.

elements.name: GetActiveEffectCodes
elements.description: - returns an Array containing the effect code of each of the calling actor's active effects, in the order in which they appear in his active effect list. An effect code's index in the returned Array can therefore be passed to the Get/SetNthActiveEffectXXX functions to operate on its associated active effect.

elements.name: GetActiveEffectCasters
elements.description: - returns an Array containing the casters of each of the calling actor's active effects, in the order in which they appear in his active effect list. A caster's index in the returned Array can therefore be passed to the Get/SetNthActiveEffectXXX functions to operate on its associated active effect. If an active effect has no caster its associated value will be zero.

elements.name: GetNthActiveEffectSummonRef
elements.description: - returns a reference to the creature associated with the specified Summon Creature active effect

elements.name: GetNthActiveEffectBoundItem
elements.description: - returns the base object associated with the specified Bound Item active effect

elements.name: IsNthActiveEffectApplied
elements.description: - returns 1 if the active effect at the specified index is currently applied to the target. An active effect may exist on the target before its effects are applied (typically for one frame after a spell is cast), in which case this command would return zero.

elements.name: GetNthActiveEffectActorValue
elements.description: - returns the actor value associated with the active effect, if any.

elements.name: SetName
elements.description: - sets the display name of the type. SetName is a special function. It is defined to work on Inventory items, but it can be used with any form. To use with a non-Inventory item you must first assign the objectID to a ref. For most forms the name is part of the base form and changing the name will change it for all instances of the type. (TODO: AddLink)

elements.name: GetName
elements.description: - returns the name of an object.

elements.name: CompareName
elements.description: - returns 1 if stringToFindInName is found in the name of the object

elements.name: CompareNames
elements.description: - compares the names of two objects and returns -1 if the first occurs alphabetically before the second, 1 if the first occurs after the second, or 0 for equality. Comparison is case-insensitive.

elements.name: CopyName
elements.description: - copies the name from the source to the target. It is defined to work on Inventory items, but it can be used with any form. To use with a non-Inventory item you must first assign the objectID to a ref. For most forms the name is part of the base form and changing the name will change it for all instances of the type.

elements.name: ModName
elements.description: - modifies the name of the calling reference or passed objectID. The toReplaceAndReplaceWith string has the following format: "toReplace|replaceWith". We will do a case insensitve search for the toReplace portion and if found will replace it with the replaceWith portion. The | character is used to separate the portions of the string. If there is nothing before the | character, the replaceWith string is prepended to the name. In the console, use @ instead of |.

elements.name: AppendToName
elements.description: - appends the passed string to the end of the name of the calling reference or passed objectID.

elements.name: HasName
elements.description: - returns 1 if the object has a id consisting of at least one character.

elements.name: SetNameEx
elements.description: - sets the name of the base object. The new name is a string constructed from a format string using the same format specifiers used by OBSE's
example: (nothing) reference.SetNameEx formatString:string var1 var2 ... var20 object:ref

elements.name: GetOwner
elements.description: - returns the NPC or faction which owns the calling reference.

elements.name: GetParentCellOwner
elements.description: - returns the NPC or faction which owns the calling reference's parent cell.

elements.name: GetOwningFactionRequiredRank
elements.description: - returns the rank in the owning faction required to legally activate the calling reference.

elements.name: GetParentCellOwningFactionRequiredRank
elements.description: - returns the rank required for ownership of the calling reference's parent cell.

elements.name: SetOwningFactionRequiredRank
elements.description: - set the rank in the owning faction required to legally activate the calling reference.

elements.name: SetParentCellOwningFactionRequiredRank
elements.description: - set the rank required for ownership of the calling reference's parent cell.

elements.name: IsOffLimits
elements.description: - returns 1 if it is illegal for the specified actor to activate the calling reference, based on the calling reference's ownership. If the argument is omitted, the player is used by default.

elements.name: GetRaceAttribute
elements.description: - returns the specified base attribute value. If passed a raceFormID you must also pass whether you want the female value or not. If called directly on a reference the function will determine the race and sex of the reference and the raceFormID and isFemale are not needed. The C version of the function takes a number rather than the actorvalue name (ie. 0 instead of Strength).

elements.name: GetRaceSkillBonus
elements.description: - returns the bonus for the specified skill for the race. If called on a reference the function will determine the race of the reference. Returns 0 if there is no bonus for that skill. The C version specifies the specific skill by number rather than by name.

elements.name: IsRaceBonusSkill
elements.description: - returns whether the specified skill is a bonus for the race. If called on a reference the function will determine the race of the reference. The C version specifies the skill by number rather than by name.

elements.name: GetNthRaceBonusSkill
elements.description: - returns the actor value code for the specified index into the bonus skills. Can be followed up with a call to GetRaceSkillBonusC to determine the actual bonus to the skill. If called on a reference the function will determine the race of the reference.

elements.name: GetRaceSpellCount
elements.description: - returns the number of spells provided by the race. If no race is specified, the race of the calling NPC is used.

elements.name: GetNthRaceSpell
elements.description: - returns the nth spell provided by the race, using the race of the calling NPC if none is specified.

elements.name: SetRaceAlias
elements.description: - creates an alias for a race. If a race has an alias, then calling

elements.name: GetRaceVoice
elements.description: - returns the race which is used to provide the voice of the specified race and gender. Pass 0 for male or 1 for female.
SetRaceVoice

elements.name: SetRacePlayable
elements.description: - flags a race as playable or unplayable. Unplayable races cannot speak most of the dialog defined in the game.

elements.name: IsRacePlayable
elements.description: - returns 1 if the specified race is flagged as playable in the editor.

elements.name: GetRaceReaction
elements.description: - returns the race reaction between the target NPC/Race and the calling NPC reference or passed race. The target and from races are declared as NPCs, but you can also place a Race name into a ref variable and pass those in.

elements.name: GetRaceScale
elements.description: - returns the default scale of the male or female members of the specified race.

elements.name: SetRaceScale
elements.description: - sets the scale for male or female members of the specified race.

elements.name: GetRaceWeight
elements.description: - returns the default weight for male or female members of the specified race as defined in the editor.

elements.name: SetRaceWeight
elements.description: - sets the weight for male or female members of the specified race.

elements.name: GetRaceDefaultHair
elements.description: - returns the default hair for male or female members of the specified race.

elements.name: GetRaceHairs
elements.description: - returns an Array of all hairs (male and female) available to actors of the specified race as defined in the editor.

elements.name: GetRaceEyes
elements.description: - returns an Array of all eyes available to actors of the specified race as defined in the editor.

elements.name: HasTail
elements.description: - returns true if the specified race or the race of the calling npc ref or specified base npc has a tail.

elements.name: GetTailModelPath
elements.description: - returns the path to the tail model used by the specified gender of the specified race or the race of the specified NPC or calling reference, if the race has a tail.

elements.name: IsScripted
elements.description: - returns whether the scriptable object has a script attached to it or not.

elements.name: GetScript
elements.description: - returns the refID of the script attached to the object

elements.name: RemoveScript
elements.description: - removes and returns the script attached to the object. The object is no longer scripted

elements.name: SetScript
elements.description: - sets the specified script onto the calling object and returns any previous script. Note that Oblivion doesn't have a script variable type so you must assign the script to a ref variable for this to work.

elements.name: IsFormValid
elements.description: - returns 1 if the specified ref variable contains a valid object or reference.

elements.name: IsReference
elements.description: - returns 1 if the specified ref variable contains a reference, as opposed to a base object.

elements.name: HasVariable
elements.description: - returns 1 if the calling reference or specified quest has a variable with the specified name.

elements.name: GetVariable
elements.description: - returns the value of a numeric variable by name, either from the calling reference's script or the specified quest.

elements.name: GetRefVariable
elements.description: - returns the reference stored in a ref variable by name, either from the calling reference's script or the specified quest.

elements.name: GetArrayVariable
elements.description: (GetArrayVar) - returns the value of an array variable by name, either from the calling reference's script or the specified quest.

elements.name: CompareScripts
elements.description: - compares the compiled code of two scripts and returns 1 if they are identical. Note that this doesn't mean the text of the scripts are identical, only that they call the same functions in the same order with the same parameters.

elements.name: ResetAllVariables
elements.description: - sets all variables in the calling script to zero.

elements.name: GetNumExplicitRefs
elements.description: -  returns the number of explicit references in the calling object's script or in the passed script object. Explicit references are any objects mentioned by name in the script; for instance, if a script contains an "OnHit Player" block or a "Player.AddItem" command, its explicit references will include the player.

elements.name: GetNthExplicitRef
elements.description: - returns the

elements.name: GetCurrentScript
elements.description: - returns the script which is currently executing.

elements.name: SetModelPath
elements.description: - sets the model path for the type.

elements.name: GetModelPath
elements.description: - returns the model path for the object.

elements.name: SetIconPath
elements.description: - sets the icon path for the type.

elements.name: GetIconPath
elements.description: - returns the icon path for the object.
CompareModelPath

elements.name: CompareIconPath
elements.description: - returns whether the passed string is part of the icon path. This is a case insensitive search.

elements.name: CopyModelPath
elements.description: - sets the model path of the calling reference or passed objectID to the model path offromObject

elements.name: CopyIconPath
elements.description: - sets the icon path of the calling reference or passed objectID to the icon path of fromObject

elements.name: ModModelPath
elements.description: - modifies the model path of the calling reference or passed objectID. The

elements.name: ModIconPath
elements.description: - modifies the icon path of the calling reference or passed objectID. The

elements.name: IsModelPathValid
elements.description: - returns 1 if the model path for the object exists in the user's Data folder or within one of the BSA archives.

elements.name: IsIconPathValid
elements.description: - returns 1 if the icon path for the object exists in the user's Data folder or within one of the BSA archives.

elements.name: GetTexturePath
elements.description: - returns the texture path of an object. This command is identical to GetIconPath, but also works for other object types such as skills, classes, and miscellaneous objects.

elements.name: SetTexturePath
elements.description: - sets the texture path of an object. This command works for a broader set of objects than SetIconPathEX.

elements.name: GetEditorSize
elements.description: - returns the value contained in the hidden 'size' field of the editor's object window for the specified object. This is a rough scalar approximation of the dimensions of the object. Return value is typically similar to that of

elements.name: SetMaleBipedPath
elements.description: - sets the male NIF model path when worn

elements.name: SetFemaleBipedPath
elements.description: - sets the female NIF model path when worn

elements.name: SetMaleGroundPath
elements.description: - sets the male model path when dropped

elements.name: SetFemaleGroundPath
elements.description: - sets the female model path when dropped

elements.name: SetMaleIconPath
elements.description: - sets the male icon texture

elements.name: SetFemaleIconPath
elements.description: - sets the female icon texture

elements.name: IsPlayable
elements.description: - returns whether the specified object is playable or not. Returns true only if the object is of a type which can be flagged as playable in the editor.

elements.name: IsPlayable2
elements.description: - returns whether the specified object is playable or not. If the object is of a type which cannot be flagged as playable in the editor, this function returns true.

elements.name: SetIsPlayable
elements.description: - specifies whether the object can be used by the player

elements.name: IsBipedIconPathValid
elements.description: - returns 1 if the icon path for the object exists in the user's Data folder or within one of the BSA archives.

elements.name: IsBipedModelPathValid
elements.description: - returns 1 if the model path for the object exists in the user's Data folder or within one of the BSA archives.

elements.name: GetBipedModelPath
elements.description: - returns the file path of one of the models for the specified biped object.

elements.name: SetBipedModelPathEX
elements.description: - sets the file path of the male or female model for the specified biped object.

elements.name: GetBipedIconPath
elements.description: - returns the file path of one of the icons for the specified biped object.

elements.name: SetBipedIconPathEX
elements.description: - sets the file path of the male or female icon for the specified biped object.

elements.name: GetHidesRings
elements.description: - returns 1 if the "hides rings" flag is set for the biped object.

elements.name: GetHidesAmulet
elements.description: - returns 1 if the "hides amulet" flag is set for the biped object.

elements.name: SetHidesRings
elements.description: - modifies the "hides rings" flag.

elements.name: SetHidesAmulet
elements.description: - modifies the "hides amulet" flag.

elements.name: GetBipedSlotMask
elements.description: - returns the slots occupied by a biped object.

elements.name: SetBipedSlotMask
elements.description: - sets the slots occupied by a biped object.

elements.name: GetNumDetectedActors
elements.description: - returns the number of other actors of which the calling actor may detect. This includes actors detected at "Lost" or "Unseen" level.

elements.name: GetNthDetectedActor
elements.description: - returns the Nth actor in the calling actor's detection list

elements.name: SetDetectionState
elements.description: - sets the

elements.name: IsBlocking
elements.description: - returns 1 if the calling actor is blocking

elements.name: IsAttacking
elements.description: - returns 1 if the calling actor is attacking

elements.name: IsRecoiling
elements.description: - returns 1 if the calling actor is recoiling

elements.name: IsDodging
elements.description: - returns 1 if the calling actor is dodging

elements.name: IsStaggered
elements.description: - returns 1 if the calling actor is staggered

elements.name: IsMovingForward
elements.description: - returns 1 if the calling actor is attempting to move forward, even if his path is blocked.

elements.name: IsMovingLeft
elements.description: - returns 1 if the calling actor is attempting to strafe left

elements.name: IsMovingRight
elements.description: - returns 1 if the calling actor is attempting to strafe right

elements.name: IsMovingBackward
elements.description: - returns 1 if the calling actor is attempting to move backwards

elements.name: IsTurningLeft
elements.description: - returns 1 if the calling actor is turning left

elements.name: IsTurningRight
elements.description: - returns 1 if the calling actor is turning right

elements.name: IsInAir
elements.description: - returns 1 if the calling actor is airborne, whether jumping or falling

elements.name: IsJumping
elements.description: - returns 1 if the calling actor is beginning to jump (playing the JumpStart anim group)

elements.name: IsOnGround
elements.description: - returns 1 if the calling actor is on the ground

elements.name: IsFlying
elements.description: - returns 1 if the calling actor is flying. Only creatures can fly.

elements.name: IsPowerAttacking
elements.description: - returns 1 if the calling actor is executing a power attack. See also the note on

elements.name: IsCasting
elements.description: - returns 1 if the calling actor is casting a spell

elements.name: GetFallTimer
elements.description: - returns the length of time for which the actor has been falling

elements.name: IsAnimGroupPlaying
elements.description: - returns 1 if the specified

elements.name: AnimPathIncludes
elements.description: - returns 1 if one of the calling actor's currently playing animation paths includes the specified substring

elements.name: GetProcessLevel
elements.description: - returns the actor's current process level, or -1 if called on a non-actor. Process level determines how frequently the game updates an actor's AI. In general, high process actors are in the same cell as the player, while more distant actors are kept at a lower process level.

elements.name: GetEquippedItems
elements.description: - returns an array containing all items currently equipped by the calling actor

elements.name: GetSpells
elements.description: - returns an array containing all of the spells in an actor's spell list.

elements.name: GetActorAlpha
elements.description: - actor references can be made more or less opaque or transparent by changing their alpha property via SetActorAlpha. This function returns the calling actor's current alpha as a floating point number between 0.0 and 1.0, with 0.0 corresponding to fully transparent and 1.0 to fully opaque.

elements.name: GetBaseActorValueC
elements.description: - identical to the game's GetBaseAV command, but accepts an integer actor value code.

elements.name: GetBaseAV3
elements.description: - returns the same value as the game's GetBaseAV command, but does not include the effects of Fortify abilities.

elements.name: GetBaseAV3C
elements.description: - as GetBaseAV3, but takes an actor value code instead of an actor value name.

elements.name: GetAllies
elements.description: -  for an actor in combat, returns an Array of other actors which the game considers allies of the calling actor at that particular moment.

elements.name: GetTargets
elements.description: - for an actor in combat, returns an Array of actors which the game considers potential targets of the calling actor at that particular moment.

elements.name: GetSelectedSpells
elements.description: - for an actor in combat, returns an Array containing zero to seven spells which the actor has selected from his full spell list (including spells resolved from leveled spell lists) for use. The list contains a maximum of one spell from each of the following categories: bound armor, bound weapon, "buff", melee, ranged, restorative, and summon spells.

elements.name: GetCombatSpells
elements.description: - for an actor in combat, returns an Array of all the spells in the actor's spellbook, including spells resolved from leveled spells lists (which are resolved into actual spells when the actor enters combat). The actor will use a subset of these spells during combat; use GetSelectedSpells to determine which of these spells have been selected for use.

elements.name: PlayIdle
elements.description: - attempts to make the calling actor play the specified idle animation. The animation must be one defined in the editor's Gameplay > Idle Animations window. Pass 1 for the forceIdle parameter to force the actor to play the idle regardless of any other animations currently playing.

elements.name: IsNaked
elements.description: - returns 1 if the calling actor is naked, 0 otherwise. Naked means without a lowerbody equipment. If requireUpperbody is 1 it also requires an upperbody equipment.

elements.name: SetPackageTarget
elements.description: - sets the target of the specified package. Target can be of several types, leading to several syntaxes for this command. The first listed usage sets the target to a specific reference. The second sets it to a particular base object with a specified quantity; when the package executes the actor will look for references to that base object to use as the target(s). The third usage sets the target to a

elements.name: GetPackageData
elements.description: - returns a stringmap containing info about a package. The returned stringmap contains the following keys:

elements.name: GetPackageScheduleData
elements.description: - returns a stringmap containing info about a package schedule. The returned stringmap contains the following keys:

elements.name: GetPackageLocationData
elements.description: - returns a stringmap containing info about a package location. The returned stringmap contains the following keys:

elements.name: GetPackageTargetData
elements.description: - returns a stringmap containing info about a package target. The returned stringmap contains the following keys:

elements.name: SetPackageData
elements.description: - sets the target, schedule, and/or location of a package. It accepts a stringmap consisting of one or more stringmaps with keys "Location", "Target", or "Schedule", each following the formats listed above. If any data is omitted, the existing package data will be retained.

elements.name: SetPackageTargetData
elements.description: - sets the target of a package. Accepts a stringmap of the same format as that returned by

elements.name: SetPackageLocationData
elements.description: - sets the location of a package based on the passed stringmap of the same format as that returned by

elements.name: SetPackageScheduleData
elements.description: - sets the schedule of a package. Accepts a stringmap of the same format as that returned by

elements.name: IsPoison
elements.description: - returns whether the alchemy item is a poison.

elements.name: MatchPotion
elements.description: - Oblivion keeps track of potions created by the player and reuses them if another potion is created with the same effects as one created previously. This command takes a potion and returns a previously-created potion bearing the same effects, if one exists. Note that in some cases it may return the same potion that was passed as the argument. Mainly useful during potion creation in the Alchemy menu, or when dynamically modifying potion effects via script.

elements.name: GetApparatusType
elements.description: - returns the alchemy apparatus type of the calling reference or passed objectID

elements.name: SetApparatusType
elements.description: - sets the alchemy type of the calling reference or passed objectID

elements.name: GetQuality
elements.description: - returns the quality level of the calling reference or passed objectID

elements.name: SetQuality
elements.description: - sets the quality level of the calling reference or passed objectID

elements.name: ModQuality
elements.description: - modifies the quality of the calling reference or passed objectID

elements.name: GetArmorAR
elements.description: - returns the armor rating of the object

elements.name: SetArmorAR
elements.description: - sets the armor rating of the object

elements.name: ModArmorAR
elements.description: - modifies the armor rating of the object up or down

elements.name: GetArmorType
elements.description: - returns 0 if light armor and 1 if heavy armor

elements.name: SetArmorType
elements.description: - sets whether the armor is heavy or light

elements.name: GetBirthsignSpells
elements.description: - returns an Array containing the spells associated with the specified birthsign

elements.name: GetBookCantBeTaken
elements.description: - returns 1 if the book cannot be taken

elements.name: GetBookIsScroll
elements.description: - returns whether the book is a scroll or not

elements.name: GetBookSkillTaught
elements.description: - returns the skill taught by the book. If no skill is taught, returns -1.

elements.name: SetBookCantBeTaken
elements.description: - sets whether the book can be taken

elements.name: SetBookIsScroll
elements.description: - sets whether the book is a scroll

elements.name: SetBookSkillTaught
elements.description: - sets the skill the book teaches. The the skillTaught value is not one of the skills, sets the value to 255.

elements.name: GetBookText
elements.description: - returns the text of a book as a string. The result must be assigned to a string variable.

elements.name: GetBookLength
elements.description: - returns the number of characters in a book's text.

elements.name: GetCellMusicType
elements.description: - returns the music type of the player's current cell.

elements.name: SetCellMusicType
elements.description: - sets the music type used in the specified cell.

elements.name: SetCellWaterHeight
elements.description: - changes the water height of the specified cell. In order for the command to take full effect, the cell must be reloaded (con_PurgeCellBuffers can be used to forcibly unload it if it is still in memory). If used to alter the water height in a loaded cell, the water shader will reflect the new height and actors will switch between swimming and walking animations appropriately. However, floating physics and the water surface will not be updated until the cell is reloaded. This command has no effect in exteriors or in cells which have no water.

elements.name: GetCellDetachTime
elements.description: - returns the cell's detach time, described above.

elements.name: GetCellResetHours
elements.description: - returns the number of hours which must pass in the game before the cell is reset.

elements.name: SetCellResetHours
elements.description: - sets the number of hours which mustpass before the cell is reset. This value must be less than the game setting iHoursToRespawnCell. Using this function to modify the reset hours for the current cell, or for exterior cells, has no effect.

elements.name: GetCellBehavesAsExterior
elements.description: - returns true if the "behaves as exterior" cell is checked for the specified interior cell.

elements.name: IsCellPublic
elements.description: - returns 1 if the cell is marked as 'public'.

elements.name: SetCellIsPublic
elements.description: - sets the 'public' flag for the cell.

elements.name: SetCellHasWater
elements.description: - sets the flag indicating whether or not the interior cell has water. Only affects interior cells, and changes are not visible until the cell is reloaded. Has no effect if called while the player is inside the specified cell.

elements.name: SetCellBehavesAsExterior
elements.description: - sets the 'behaves like exterior' flag for the interior cell. Has no effect if called while the player is inside the specified cell.

elements.name: GetCellClimate
elements.description: - returns the climate for the specified cell.

elements.name: SetCellClimate
elements.description: - sets the climate for the specified cell.

elements.name: GetCellLighting
elements.description: - returns a StringMap describing the lighting properties for the interior cell. The StringMap contains the following key-value pairs corresponding to the fields in the editor's Cell Lighting tab, where 'RGB Array' is a 3-element Array with values from 0-255 in the order {red, green, blue}:

elements.name: SetCellLighting
elements.description: - alters one or more of an interior cell's lighting fields, taking a StringMap of the same format as that returned by

elements.name: GetTerrainHeight
elements.description: - returns the height of the terrain mesh at the specified x and y coordinates within the current exterior worldspace. X and Y are worldspace coordinates (e.g. as returned by GetPos). If the coordinates are outside of any loaded cells, returns 0.0. Note that this command does not check for collision with surfaces other than terrain.

elements.name: IsOblivionInterior
elements.description: - returns 1 if the "Oblivion interior" flag has been checked for the specified interior cell.

elements.name: IsOblivionWorld
elements.description: - returns 1 if the "Oblivion World" flag has been checked for the specified world space.

elements.name: CanFastTravelFromWorld
elements.description: - returns 1 if the player is allowed to fast-travel from the specified world space.

elements.name: SetCanFastTravelFromWorld
elements.description: - sets whether the player can fast-travel from the specified world space.

elements.name: GetCellWaterType
elements.description: - returns the Water used by the interior cell. Returns zero if the cell has no water, or if the cell uses the default water type.

elements.name: SetCellWaterType
elements.description: - sets the Water used by the interior cell. Changes will not be visible until the cell is reloaded.

elements.name: GetCellNorthRotation
elements.description: - returns the rotation on the Z axis of the north marker within the specified interior cell, if one is present. The game uses the north marker's Z rotation to determine what direction is considered "north". Rotation returned is in degrees and is 0.0 if no north marker is present in the specified cell.

elements.name: IsInvertFastTravel
elements.description: - returns true if the cell has InvertFastTravel flag

elements.name: SetInvertFastTravel
elements.description: - sets the InvertFastTravel flag on the provided cell, reversing the behaviour for the cell type regarding fast travel, allowing travel from interiors.

elements.name: IsCantWait
elements.description: - returns true if the cell has CantWait flag

elements.name: SetCantWait
elements.description: - sets the CantWait flag on the provided cell, preventing waiting (and sleeping) inside. The change isn't backed into the savegame

elements.name: GetCurrentClimateID
elements.description: - returns the refID of the current climate.

elements.name: GetClimateSunriseBegin
elements.description: - returns the time sunrise begins specified as a number of 10 minute units since midnight.

elements.name: GetClimateSunriseEnd
elements.description: - returns the time sunrise ends specified as a number of 10 minute units since midnight.

elements.name: GetClimateSunsetBegin
elements.description: - returns the time sunset begins specified as a number of 10 minute units since midnight.

elements.name: GetClimateSunsetEnd
elements.description: - returns the time sunset ends specified as a number of 10 minute units since midnight.

elements.name: GetClimateMoonPhaseLength
elements.description: - returns the number of days in the phase of the moons. The total moon cycle length is 8 x PhaseLength according to the CS.

elements.name: GetClimateHasMasser
elements.description: - returns 1 if the current climate shows the moon Masser.

elements.name: GetClimateHasSecunda
elements.description: - returns 1 if the current climate shows the moon Secunda.

elements.name: RefreshCurrentClimate
elements.description: - refreshes the climate info to reflect changes made by the SetClimateXXX functions.

elements.name: SetClimateSunriseBegin
elements.description: - sets the time sunrise begins as a number of 10 minute units since midnight.

elements.name: SetClimateSunriseEnd
elements.description: - sets the time sunrise ends as a number of 10 minute units since midnight,

elements.name: SetClimateSunsetBegin
elements.description: - sets the time sunset begins as a number of 10 minute units since midnight.

elements.name: SetClimateSunsetEnd
elements.description: - sets the time sunset ends as a number of 10 minute units since midnight.

elements.name: SetClimateMoonPhaseLength
elements.description: - sets the number of days in the phase of the moons

elements.name: SetClimateHasMasser
elements.description: - sets  whether the climate shows the moon Masser

elements.name: SetClimateHasSecunda
elements.description: - sets whether the climate shows the moon Secunda

elements.name: GetClimateVolatility
elements.description: - returns the volatility of the climate

elements.name: SetClimateVolatility
elements.description: - sets the volatility of the climate

elements.name: IsCreature
elements.description: - returns whether the reference or passed id is a creature

elements.name: GetCreatureType
elements.description: - returns the type of the creature (Undead, Humanoid, Daedrea etc)

elements.name: SetCreatureType
elements.description: - attempts to change the type of the creature.

elements.name: GetCreatureCombatSkill
elements.description: - returns the combat skill for the creature

elements.name: GetCreatureMagicSkill
elements.description: - returns the magic skill for the creature

elements.name: GetCreatureStealthSkill
elements.description: - returns the stealth skill for the creature

elements.name: SetCreatureSkill
elements.description: - sets the value of one of the creature's skills. Pass "stealth", "magic", or "combat" as the skill name. The skill value must be between 0 and 255.

elements.name: GetCreatureReach
elements.description: - returns the reach of the creature

elements.name: GetCreatureSoulLevel
elements.description: - returns the soul level of the creature

elements.name: GetCreatureBaseScale
elements.description: - retuns the base scale of the creature

elements.name: GetCreatureWalks
elements.description: - returns 1 if the Walks flag is set on the creature

elements.name: GetCreatureSwims
elements.description: - returns 1 if the Swims flag is set on the creature

elements.name: GetCreatureFlies
elements.description: - returns 1 if the Flies flag is set on the creature

elements.name: IsCreatureBiped
elements.description: - returns 1 if the Biped flag is set on the creature

elements.name: CreatureHasNoMovement
elements.description: - returns 1 if the No Movement flag is set on the creature

elements.name: CreatureHasNoHead
elements.description: - returns 1 if the No Head flag is set on the creature

elements.name: CreatureHasNoLeftArm
elements.description: - returns 1 if the No Left Arm flag is set on the creature.

elements.name: CreatureHasNoRightArm
elements.description: - returns 1 if the No Right Arm flag is set on the creature.

elements.name: CreatureNoCombatInWater
elements.description: - returns 1 if the No Combat In Water flag is set on the creature.

elements.name: CreatureUsesWeaponAndShield
elements.description: - returns 1 if the Uses Weapon and Shield flag is set on the creature.

elements.name: GetRider
elements.description: - returns the NPC currently riding the calling horse.

elements.name: GetCreatureSoundBase
elements.description: - returns the creature from which the specified creature's sounds are derived, if any.

elements.name: SetCreatureSoundBase
elements.description: - sets the creature from which the creature inherits its sounds. The inheriting creature must not itself be a sound base (mustn't define its own sounds), and the creature specified as the sound base must be a sound base (defining its own sounds) or null.

elements.name: GetCreatureSound
elements.description: - returns the creature's sound associated with the specified action.

elements.name: HasModel
elements.description: - returns 1 if the creature's model list includes the specified .nif file. The file must appear in the creature's meshes folder. String must include the ".nif" extension and is case-insensitive.

elements.name: ToggleCreatureModel
elements.description: - toggles a model within a creature's model list on or off. The model path must be relative to the creature's model folder and include the ".nif" extension. When called on a reference which is currently being rendered, the reference must be disabled and then enabled before the change is visible.

elements.name: GetCreatureModelPaths
elements.description: - returns an Array containing the set of model paths in the creature's model list. Only those models which are toggled on are included.

elements.name: GetCombatStyle
elements.description: - returns the combat style assigned to the calling reference.

elements.name: IsLoadDoor
elements.description: - returns 1 if the calling reference is a load door

elements.name: GetLinkedDoor
elements.description: - returns the door to which the calling load door is linked

elements.name: GetTeleportCell
elements.description: - returns the cell to which the calling load door teleports

elements.name: IsOblivionGate
elements.description: -returns true if the door is flagged as an Oblivion gate in the editor.

elements.name: IsHiddenDoor
elements.description: - returns 1 if the "hidden" flag is set for the door.

elements.name: IsAutomaticDoor
elements.description: - returns 1 if the "Automatic" flag is set for the door.

elements.name: IsMinimalUseDoor
elements.description: - returns 1 if the "Minimal Use" flag is set for the door.

elements.name: SetIsHiddenDoor
elements.description: - sets or clears the "hidden" flag for the door.

elements.name: SetIsAutomaticDoor
elements.description: - sets or clears the "Automatic" flag for the door.

elements.name: SetIsMinimalUseDoor
elements.description: - sets or clears the "Minimal Use" flag for the door.

elements.name: SetIsOblivionGate
elements.description: - sets or clears the "Oblivion Gate" flag for the door.

elements.name: SetDoorTeleport
elements.description: - sets the reference, coordinates, and rotation to which the calling door teleports. Only the reference argument is required; the values for the others will be taken from the specified reference's coordinates and rotation if omitted. The bTemporary argument specifies that the change should not be saved in the savegame; by default, or if the argument is zero, the change will be saved.
example: (nothing) reference.SetDoorTeleport teleportTo:ref x:float y:float z:float rot:float bTemporary:bool

elements.name: LinkToDoor
elements.description: - links the calling door reference to the specified door reference. This causes each of the doors to teleport to the other when activated. Both doors must be persistent references and neither can already be linked to another door. Actors will use the doors in their pathfinding. The change persists in the savegame.

elements.name: GetDoorTeleportX
elements.description: - returns the x coordinate to which the calling door teleports.

elements.name: GetDoorTeleportY
elements.description: - returns the y coordinate to which the calling door teleports.

elements.name: GetDoorTeleportZ
elements.description: - returns the z coordinate to which the calling door teleports.

elements.name: GetDoorTeleportRot
elements.description: - returns the rotation to which the calling door teleports. This is the angle the player will be facing after activatingthe load door.

elements.name: GetTeleportCellName
elements.description: - when called on a teleporting door reference, returns the name of the cell or worldspace to which the door teleports

elements.name: GetEnchantmentType
elements.description: - returns the type of the enchantment

elements.name: SetEnchantmentType
elements.description: - sets the type of the enchantment

elements.name: GetEnchantmentCharge
elements.description: - returns the charge of the enchantment. Of unknown and dubious use.

elements.name: SetEnchantmentCharge
elements.description: - sets the charge of the enchantment. Of unknown and dubious use.

elements.name: ModEnchantmentCharge
elements.description: - modifies the charge of the enchantment. Of unknown and dubious use.

elements.name: GetEnchantmentCost
elements.description: - returns the magicka charge cost for using the enchantment.

elements.name: SetEnchantmentCost
elements.description: - sets the cost for using the enchantment.

elements.name: ModEnchantmentCost
elements.description: - modifies the cost for using the enchantment up or down.

elements.name: FactionHasSpecialCombat
elements.description: - returns 1 if the Special Combat flag is set on the faction

elements.name: IsFactionEvil
elements.description: - returns 1 if the faction is marked as evil.

elements.name: IsFactionHidden
elements.description: - returns 1 if the faction is not shown on the player's faction sheet.

elements.name: SetFactionEvil
elements.description: - changes the Evil flag on the faction. Changes are saved in the savegame.

elements.name: SetFactionHidden
elements.description: - changes the Hidden flag on the faction. Changes are saved in the savegame.

elements.name: SetFactionHasSpecialCombat
elements.description: - changes the Special Combat flag on the faction. Changes are saved in the savegame.

elements.name: GetNumRanks
elements.description: - returns the number of ranks in the faction.

elements.name: GetNthFactionRankName
elements.description: - returns the title of the nth rank in a faction. Optionally returns the female rank name.

elements.name: SetNthFactionRankNameEX
elements.description: - sets the title of the nth rank in a faction. Optionally sets the female rank name.

elements.name: IsHarvested
elements.description: - returns 1 if the calling reference's ingredient has been harvested.

elements.name: SetHarvested
elements.description: - mark or unmark the calling reference as having been harvested. Changes are saved in the savegame.

elements.name: GetIngredient
elements.description: - returns the ingredient contained in a plant.

elements.name: SetIngredient
elements.description: - sets the ingredient contained in a plant. Omit the ingredient parameter or pass an empty ref variable to set it to "no ingredient."

elements.name: GetIngredientChance
elements.description: - returns the % chance of harvesting an ingredient from the plant for a specific season where 0 = spring, 1 = summer, 2 = autumn, and 3 = winter. Return value ranges from 0 to 100.

elements.name: SetIngredientChance
elements.description: - sets the %chance of harvesting an ingredient based on the specified season.

elements.name: AddToLeveledList
elements.description: - adds an object to a leveled creature, spell, or item list.

elements.name: RemoveFromLeveledList
elements.description: - removes all occurences of an object from a leveled list and returns the number of occurences removed.

elements.name: CalcLeveledItem
elements.description: - returns one item from a leveled item list, selected randomly for a character of the specified level.

elements.name: CalcLevItemNR
elements.description: - does the same thing as CalcLeveledItem but will not recurse through nested leveled lists. This means that unlike CalcLeveledItem, CalcLevItemNR can return another leveled list rather than a real object.

elements.name: CalcLevItems
elements.description: - returns an Array of StringMaps representing items selected randomly from a leveled item list. This command uses the game code to select items, which means the items returned are the same as those the game would select for an actor of the specified level. Each entry in the returned Array is a StringMap with the key-value pairs: "item":item (form) and "count":count (integer). The optional "count" parameter is 1 by default.

elements.name: GetCalcAllLevels
elements.description: - returns 1 if the "calculate for all levels <= PC level" flag is checked.

elements.name: SetCalcAllLevels
elements.description: - sets the "calculate for all levels <= PC level" flag on the leveled list.

elements.name: GetCalcEachInCount
elements.description: - returns 1 if the "calculate for each item in count" flag is checked.

elements.name: GetChanceNone
elements.description: - returns the chance from 0 to 100 that a leveled list returns no item.

elements.name: GetNthLevItem
elements.description: - returns the Nth element in a leveled list, as ordered in the Construction Set.

elements.name: GetNthLevItemCount
elements.description: - returns the count of the Nth element of a leveled list.

elements.name: GetNthLevItemLevel
elements.description: - returns the level of the Nth element of a leveled list.

elements.name: GetNumLevItems
elements.description: - returns the number of elements in a leveled list.

elements.name: GetLevItemByLevel
elements.description: - returns the first element of the specified level in the leveled list.

elements.name: RemoveLevItemByLevel
elements.description: - removes any elements of the specified level from a leveled list

elements.name: ClearLeveledList
elements.description: - removes all elements from a leveled list.

elements.name: RemoveNthLevItem
elements.description: - removes the nth item from a leveled list.

elements.name: GetLevItemIndexByLevel
elements.description: - returns the index of the first item of the specified level within a leveled list, or -1 if no item exists for that level.

elements.name: GetLevItemIndexByForm
elements.description: - returns the index of the first occurrence of the specified form in a leveled list, or -1 if the form is not found.

elements.name: SetChanceNone
elements.description: - sets the chance that a leveled list generates no item.

elements.name: GetLevCreatureTemplate
elements.description: - gets the template actor of a leveled creature list.

elements.name: SetLevCreatureTemplate
