elements.description: - sets the template actor of a leveled creature. Omitting or passing a null ref as the second argument will remove any existing template.

elements.name: IsLightCarriable
elements.description: - returns 1 if the light may be placed in an inventory.

elements.name: GetLightRadius
elements.description: - returns the radius of the light.

elements.name: SetLightRadius
elements.description: - sets the radius of the light. Changes are not saved in the savegame.

elements.name: GetLightRGB
elements.description: - returns the red, green, and blue components of the light's color as an Array of 3 elements of values 0 through 255. The first element corresponds to the red value, the second to green, and the third to blue.

elements.name: SetLightRGB
elements.description: - sets the red, green, and blue components of the light's color, accepting the components as an Array of 3 elements of values 0 through 255. The first element corresponds to the red value, the second to green, and the third to blue.

elements.name: GetLightDuration
elements.description: - returns the duration of the light as defined in the editor.

elements.name: SetLightDuration
elements.description: - sets the duration of the light.

elements.name: GetTimeLeft
elements.description: - returns the amount of time left before the calling light reference expires.

elements.name: GetEquippedTorchTimeLeft
elements.description: - returns the amount of time before the torch equipped by the calling actor expires.

elements.name: SetTimeLeft
elements.description: - sets the amount of time before the calling light reference expires.

elements.name: GetMagicEffectCode
elements.description: - returns the magic effect code of the effect.

elements.name: GetMagicEffectChars
elements.description: - returns the 4-character code for a magic effect

elements.name: GetMagicEffectCharsC
elements.description: - returns the 4-character code for a magic effect

elements.name: MagicEffectFromCode
elements.description: - given an effect code, returns the effect setting matching that code.

elements.name: MagicEffectFromChars
elements.description: - given a string representing a four-letter effect code (e.g. "REHE"), returns the effect setting matching that code

elements.name: MagicEffectCodeFromChars
elements.description: - given a string representing a four-letter effect code (e.g. "REHE"), returns the effect code for the associated effect setting.

elements.name: GetMagicEffectBaseCost(C)
elements.description: - returns the base cost of the magic effect

elements.name: GetMagicEffectSchool(C)
elements.description: - returns the controlling school of the magic effect

elements.name: GetMagicEffectProjectileSpeed(C)
elements.description: - returns the projectile speed of the magic effect

elements.name: GetMagicEffectEnchantFactor(C)
elements.description: - returns the constant effect enchantment factor of the magic effect

elements.name: GetMagicEffectBarterFactor(C)
elements.description: - returns the constant effect barter factor of the magic effect

elements.name: IsMagicEffectHostile(C)
elements.description: - returns whether the magic effect is hostile

elements.name: IsMagicEffectForSpellmaking(C)
elements.description: - returns whether the magic effect can be used for spell making

elements.name: IsMagicEffectForEnchanting(C)
elements.description: - returns whether the magic effect can be used when enchanting

elements.name: IsMagicEffectDetrimental(C)
elements.description: - returns whether the magic effect harms the receipient

elements.name: IsMagicEffectCanRecover(C)
elements.description: - returns whether the target can recover from the effect

elements.name: IsMagicEffectMagnitudePercent(C)
elements.description: - returns whether the magic effect's magnitude is a percentage

elements.name: MagicEffectFXPersists(C)
elements.description: - returns whether the magic effect's graphics effects persist

elements.name: IsMagicEffectOnSelfAllowed(C)
elements.description: - returns whether the magic effect can be cast on self

elements.name: IsMagicEffectOnTouchAllowed(C)
elements.description: - returns whether the magic effect can be cast on touch

elements.name: IsMagicEffectOnTargetAllowed(C)
elements.description: - returns whether the magic effect can be cast on target

elements.name: MagicEffectHasNoDuration(C)
elements.description: - returns whether the magic effect doesn't use the duration value

elements.name: MagicEffectHasNoMagnitude(C)
elements.description: - returns whether the magic effect doesn't use the magnitude value

elements.name: MagicEffectHasNoArea(C)
elements.description: - returns whether the magic effect doesn't use the area value

elements.name: MagicEffectHasNoIngredient(C)
elements.description: - returns whether the magic effect has no ingredient

elements.name: MagicEffectHasNoHitEffect(C)
elements.description: - returns whether the magic effect has a graphic effect when it hits

elements.name: MagicEffectUsesWeapon(C)
elements.description: - returns whether the magic effect summons a weapon

elements.name: MagicEffectUsesArmor(C)
elements.description: - returns whether the magic effect summons armor

elements.name: MagicEffectUsesCreature(C)
elements.description: - returns whether the magic effect summons a creature

elements.name: MagicEffectUsesSkill(C)
elements.description: - returns whether the magic effect affects a skill

elements.name: MagicEffectUsesAttribute(C)
elements.description: - returns whether the magic effect affects an attribute

elements.name: MagicEffectUsesOtherActorValue(C)
elements.description: - returns whether the magic effect affects an actor value that is not a skill or an attribute

elements.name: GetMagicEffectOtherActorValue(C)
elements.description: - returns the actor value (skill, attribute or other) affected by the magic effect

elements.name: GetMagicEffectUsedObject(C)
elements.description: - returns the weapon, armor or creature summoned by the magic effect

elements.name: RemoveNthMagicEffectCounter(C)
elements.description: - removes the

elements.name: AddMagicEffectCounter(C)
elements.description: - adds a counter-effect to the magic effect. The 'C' version accepts magic effect codes for both arguments.

elements.name: GetMagicEffectCounters(C)
elements.description: - returns an Array containing the effect codes of all counter-effects for the specified magic effect.

elements.name: SetMagicEffectCounters(C)
elements.description: - accepts an Array of effect codes and assigns those effects as counter-effects for the specified magic effect, overriding any existing counter-effects. The user must guarantee that the passed array contains valid effect codes and nothing else. The function returns 1 if the new counter-effects were successfully applied, 0 otherwise.

elements.name: IsMapMarkerVisible
elements.description: - returns 1 if the map marker can be seen on the player's map

elements.name: SetMapMarkerVisible
elements.description: - sets whether the map marker can be seen on the player's map

elements.name: CanTravelToMapMarker
elements.description: - returns 1 if the player can travel to the map marker by clicking on it in the map menu

elements.name: SetCanTravelToMapMarker
elements.description: - sets whether the player can travel to the map marker by clicking it in the map menu

elements.name: GetMapMarkerType
elements.description: - returns the type of icon used to represent the location on the map.

elements.name: SetMapMarkerType
elements.description: - sets the type of icon used to represent the location on the map.

elements.name: GetMapMarkers
elements.description: - returns an Array containing all map marker references. The filter argument can be used to filter out markers based on their visibility and accessibility: pass 0 to include only visible markers which can be fast-traveled to, 1 to include all visible markers, and 2 to include all markers, including those which are not visible. The default filter value is 1. Pass a

elements.name: GetEquippedObject
elements.description: - returns the base object of the item equipped in the specified slot

elements.name: GetEquipmentSlotMask
elements.description: - Returns the base object of the first equipped object to match the specified equipment slot mask. If no 'value' parameter is specified, it is assumed to be the same value as the 'mask' parameter. For example, an object taking up the UpperBody, LowerBody, and Foot slots would have a mask of 4 + 8 + 32 = 44. See the "

elements.name: GetMerchantContainer
elements.description: - returns the reference to the NPC's merchant container

elements.name: SetMerchantContainer
elements.description: - replaces the specified mechant's container and returns the old container.

elements.name: GetHorse
elements.description: - returns the horse currently ridden by the calling NPC.

elements.name: GetTravelHorse
elements.description: - returns a reference to the travel horse used by the calling reference.

elements.name: SetTravelHorse
elements.description: - Sets the travel horse used by the calling reference to the horse reference specified. Changes are not saved in the savegame.

elements.name: IsFemale
elements.description: - returns 1 if the NPC is female.

elements.name: CopyHair
elements.description: - Copies the hair style, length, and color from one NPC to another. Changes alter the base actor and are not saved in the savegame unless called on the player.

elements.name: CopyEyes
elements.description: - Copies the eyes used by one npc onto another, with the same caveats as CopyHair.

elements.name: SetHair
elements.description: - Sets the hair on the NPC to a hairstyle predefined in the CS, with the same caveats as CopyHair.

elements.name: SetEyes
elements.description: - Sets the eyes on the NPC to a set of eyes predefined in the CS, with the same caveats as CopyHair.

elements.name: GetRace
elements.description: - returns the race of an NPC.

elements.name: CopyRace
elements.description: - modifies the calling NPC reference to be the same race as the passed base NPC. The calling NPC gets the same skeleton, textures, and other race attributes of the specified base NPC. Its facial parameters, hair, and eyes do not change. This command affects the base object of the calling NPC, and should only be used on references which are unique (no other references share the same base form). Note that if the NPC's new race uses a different voice than its old voice, it may not audibly speak any race-specific dialog which has not been recorded for the new voice.

elements.name: GetHair
elements.description: - returns the NPC's hairstyle.

elements.name: GetEyes
elements.description: - returns the NPC's eyes.

elements.name: GetHairColor
elements.description: - returns the RGB value of the NPC's hair color.

elements.name: GetTrainerLevel
elements.description: - returns the level at which the NPC offers training.

elements.name: GetTrainerSkill
elements.description: - returns the skill in which the NPC offers training as an

elements.name: SetTrainerLevel
elements.description: - sets the level at which an NPC offers training.

elements.name: SetTrainerSkill
elements.description: - sets the skill in which an NPC offers training.

elements.name: GetServicesMask
elements.description: - returns an integer code representing the services offered by an NPC. The code is obtained by ORing (adding)

elements.name: OffersServicesC
elements.description: - returns 1 if the NPC offers all of the services specified by the services mask

elements.name: SetOffersServicesC
elements.description: - sets the services offered by the NPC to the specified services mask.

elements.name: GetPathNodesInRadius
elements.description: - returns an Array of all path nodes located within the circular area described by the center point (x, y) and the radius. By default, disabled nodes are ignored; pass 1 for the optional fourth argument to include them.

elements.name: GetPathNodesInRect
elements.description: - returns an Array of all path nodes located within the rectangular area described by the center point (x, y) and the extents along the x and y axes (i.e. half-width and half-height). An angle of rotation in radians can optionally be specified; if omitted the rectangle is assumed to be aligned with the world axes. By default, disabled nodes are ignored; pass 1 for the optional sixth argument to include them.
example: (nodes:Array) GetPathNodesInRect centerX:float centerY:float extentX:float extentY:float angle:float includeDisabledNodes:bool

elements.name: GetPathNodePos
elements.description: - returns the x, y, or z coordinate of the specified path node.

elements.name: IsPathNodeDisabled
elements.description: - returns 1 if the path node is disabled.

elements.name: SetPathNodeDisabled
elements.description: - enables or disables the specified path node. This node will no longer be used in future pathfinding attempts, but actors who have already built a path including this node may continue along it normally. If this is undesirable, calling EvaluatePackage on the actor will force it to build a new path.

elements.name: GetPathNodeLinkedRef
elements.description: - returns the persistent reference linked to this node in the editor, if any.

elements.name: PathEdgeExists
elements.description: - returns 1 if the two nodes are connected.

elements.name: GetCrosshairRef
elements.description: - returns a reference to whatever is currently under the player's crosshair. Generally returns zero when called during MenuMode. Note that this function will return non-activatable references as well; use

elements.name: GetPlayersLastRiddenHorse
elements.description: - returns a reference to the horse most recently ridden by the player.

elements.name: SetPlayersLastRiddenHorse
elements.description: - marks the specified horse as the horse most recently ridden by the player. This is the horse that will accompany the player when fast traveling while dismounted. The argument must be a Creature of type Horse. Additionally, in order for the new horse to fast travel with the player it must not be owned by anyone other than the player.

elements.name: ClearPlayersLastRiddenHorse
elements.description: - clears the game's memory of the horse last ridden by the player. This prevents any horse from accompanying the player when fast traveling, provided the player is not mounted on a horse when he travels.

elements.name: GetPlayersLastActivatedLoadDoor
elements.description: - returns a reference to the load door most recently activated by the player.

elements.name: GetGodMode
elements.description: - returns 1 if the player has toggled god mode on.

elements.name: SetPCAMurderer
elements.description: - sets whether the PC is a murderer or not.

elements.name: GetPlayerSpell
elements.description: - returns the objectID of the player's current spell.

elements.name: GetPlayerSpellCount
elements.description: - returns the player spell count.

elements.name: GetNthPlayerSpell
elements.description: - returns the nth player spell. whichSpell is an index that starts at 0 for the first spell in the list.

elements.name: GetPCMajorSkillUps
elements.description: - returns the number of major skill advancements toward the player's next level.

elements.name: SetPCMajorSkillUps
elements.description: - sets the number of major skill advancements toward the player's next level

elements.name: GetPCAttributeBonus
elements.description: - returns the number of skill advancements contributing to the specified attribute's bonus for the next level. Note that game setting multipliers applied to these values determine the actual bonus at level-up. Returns -1 if passed an invalid actor value, including Luck.

elements.name: SetPCAttributeBonus
elements.description: - sets the number of skill advancements contributing to the specified attribute's bonus for the next level. Note that game setting multipliers applied to these values determine the actual bonus at level-up. Does not affect Luck bonus.

elements.name: GetTotalPCAttributeBonus
elements.description: - returns the sum of the player's attribute bonuses.

elements.name: ModPCSpellEffectiveness
elements.description: - alters the script modifier applied to the player's spell effectiveness. This works similarly to Oblivion's ModAV command. Positive values increases the modifier, negative values decrease it. Any game calculations involving player spell effectiveness will use the modified value (base effectiveness + modifier). By default, the effects of this command persist until the end of the current game session. Pass 1 for the second parameter to save the amount modified in the savegame; it will then be applied every time the savegame is reloaded, and removed when reloading a different savegame.

elements.name: GetPCSpellEffectivenessModifier
elements.description: - returns the current value of the script modifier for player spell effectiveness. Subtract this value from the return value of Player.GetSpellEffectiveness to get the player's base spell effectiveness.

elements.name: GetPCTrainingSessionsUsed
elements.description: - returns the number of times the player has trained during his current level.

elements.name: SetPCTrainingSessionsUsed
elements.description: - sets the number of times the player has trained during his current level.

elements.name: ModPCMovementSpeed
elements.description: - applies a positive or negative modifier to the player's speed attribute as used in calculating his movement speed while swimming, walking, or running. The actual attribute is not modified, but movement calculations use the attribute value plus the modifier. Positive modifiers well above the maximum value of the speed attribute are permitted and effective; minimum speed including the modifier is limited to zero. By default, the effects of this command persist until the end of the current game session. Pass 1 for the second parameter to save the amount modified in the savegame; it will then be applied every time the savegame is reloaded, and removed when reloading a different savegame.
GetPCMovementSpeedModifier

elements.name: GetPlayerBirthsign
elements.description: - returns the birthsign chosen by the player.

elements.name: SetPlayerBirthsign
elements.description: - changes the player's birthsign to the one specified. This removes all effects of the previous birthsign and applies the effects of the new one.

elements.name: GetTelekinesisRef
elements.description: - returns a reference to the object being manipulated by the player through telekinesis, if any.

elements.name: GetCurrentRegions
elements.description: - returns an Array of all the regions in which the player is currently located, if any. In interior cells generally returns 0. Regions in exterior cells can overlap, therefore it's possible for the player to be in several regions simultaneously.

elements.name: GetPCLastDroppedItem
elements.description: - returns the base object of the item most recently dropped by the player.

elements.name: GetPCLastDroppedItemRef
elements.description: - returns the reference of the item most recently dropped by the player.

elements.name: GetPCAttributeBonusC
elements.description: - returns the level-up bonus for the specified attribute.

elements.name: SetPCAttributeBonusC
elements.description: - sets the level-up bonus for the specified attribute.

elements.name: GetLastUsedSigilStone
elements.description: - returns the sigil stone most recently used to enchant an item during the current game session.

elements.name: GetLastSigilStoneEnchantedItem
elements.description: - returns the unenchanted item most recently enchanted with a sigil stone during the current game session.

elements.name: GetLastSigilStoneCreatedItem
elements.description: - returns the enchanted item most recently created with a sigil stone during the current game session.

elements.name: SetFlyCameraSpeedMult
elements.description: - changes the speed multiplier for the player's camera when in fly camera mode.

elements.name: SetPlayerSkeletonPath
elements.description: - Set the specific path as the player's skeleton.

elements.name: GetProjectileType
elements.description: - returns the type of the projectile.

elements.name: GetProjectileSource
elements.description: - returns the caster of a magic projectile or the archer who fired an arrow projectile.

elements.name: GetMagicProjectileSpell
elements.description: - returns the spell attached to a magic projectile.

elements.name: SetMagicProjectileSpell
elements.description: - changes the spell attached to a magic projectile.

elements.name: GetArrowProjectileEnchantment
elements.description: - returns the enchantment on an arrow projectile.

elements.name: GetArrowProjectileBowEnchantment
elements.description: - returns the enchantment on an arrow derived from the bow from which it was fired.

elements.name: GetArrowProjectilePoison
elements.description: - returns the poison on an arrow projectile.

elements.name: SetPlayerProjectile
elements.description: - sets the player as the source of the projectile. Actors hit by the projectile will react as if the player had cast the spell or fired the arrow.

elements.name: SetProjectileSource
elements.description: - sets the source of a projectile. If an actor other than the player is set as the source, the target of the projectile will not necessarily respond to the attack.

elements.name: SetArrowProjectileEnchantment
elements.description: - sets the arrow enchantment associated with the calling projectile.

elements.name: SetArrowProjectileBowEnchantment
elements.description: - sets the bow enchantment associated with the calling projectile.

elements.name: SetArrowProjectilePoison
elements.description: - sets the poison on the calling projectile.

elements.name: GetProjectileSpeed
elements.description: - returns the speed of the projectile.

elements.name: GetProjectileDistanceTraveled
elements.description: - returns the total distance traveled by the calling projectile. Currently does not work for arrow projectiles.

elements.name: GetProjectileLifetime
elements.description: - returns the number of seconds for which the calling projectile has existed.

elements.name: SetProjectileSpeed
elements.description: - sets the speed of the projectile. Note that other factors affect the movement of a projectile so a speed of zero does not necessarily completely halt the projectile.

elements.name: GetProjectile
elements.description: - returns the projectile most recently fired by the calling actor. Optionally specify the type (1 for arrows, 2 for magic, 0 for either) and the arrow, spell, or staff enchantment to match. The minLifetime parameter specifies how old (in seconds) a projectile can be before it is ignored.

elements.name: SetActiveQuest
elements.description: - sets the players active quest.

elements.name: GetActiveQuest
elements.description: - returns the player's active quest, if any.

elements.name: ClearActiveQuest
elements.description: - clears the player's active quest, if any.

elements.name: GetCurrentQuests
elements.description: - returns a list of all currently active (uncompleted) quests. Note that this list includes quests which do not appear in the journal.

elements.name: GetCompletedQuests
elements.description: - returns a list of all completed quests.

elements.name: IsQuestComplete
elements.description: - returns 1 if the specified quest is marked as 'completed'.

elements.name: UncompleteQuest
elements.description: - removes the 'completed' flag from the specified quest.

elements.name: QuestExists
elements.description: - returns 1 if a quest exists with the specified editorID.

elements.name: GetStageIDs
elements.description: - returns an Array containing the numeric index of each quest stage associated with the specified quest.

elements.name: GetStageEntries
elements.description: - returns an Array of all of the entries associated with the specified quest stage. Each element of the array is a Stringmap containing the following fields: "day" (1-31), "month" (1-12), and "year", representing the date at which the entry was added to the player's journal, and "text" containing the log text for the entry. If the entry has not been added to the player's journal, the date fields will all be zero.

elements.name: SetStageText
elements.description: - sets the log text associated with the specified quest stage entry for the specified quest. The change remains in effect for the duration of the game session or until undone with UnsetStageText.

elements.name: UnsetStageText
elements.description: - reverses any modification made to the specified log entry text using SetStageText.

elements.name: SetStageDate
elements.description: - for a quest stage entry which has already been added to the player's journal, modifies the date at which the entry was added. Specify the day of the month (1-31), month (1-12), and year.
example: (dateSet:bool) SetStageDate quest:ref stageIndex:int entryIndex:int day:int month:int year:int

elements.name: GetParentCell
elements.description: - returns the objectID of the parent cell of the calling reference.

elements.name: GetParentWorldspace
elements.description: - returns the worldspace to which the calling reference's cell belongs, if any. In interior cells this generally returns 0.

elements.name: ParentCellHasWater
elements.description: - returns 1 if the reference's parent cell can contain water.

elements.name: GetParentCellWaterHeight
elements.description: - returns the water height of the references parent cell.

elements.name: IsActivatable
elements.description: - returns 1 if the calling reference can be activated under normal circumstances.

elements.name: IsUnderWater
elements.description: - returns 1 if the calling reference's Z position is less than 120 units under its parent cell's water height.

elements.name: GetNumChildRefs
elements.description: - returns the number of reference for which the calling reference behaves as an enable-state parent.

elements.name: GetNthChildRef
elements.description: - returns the nth child reference associated with the calling reference. Child references are stored in no particular order.

elements.name: GetNumFollowers
elements.description: - returns the number of actors currently following the calling actor. Summoned creatures are excluded.

elements.name: GetNthFollower
elements.description: - returns a reference to the nth actor currently following the calling actor. Does not include summoned creatures.

elements.name: GetFollowers
elements.description: - returns an array containing all actors currently following the calling actor, including summoned creatures.

elements.name: IsPersistent
elements.description: - returns 1 if the calling reference is a persistent reference.

elements.name: SetScaleEX
elements.description: - sets the scale of the calling reference. Unlike SetScale, the scale is not limited to a certain range. The reference should be disabled and then enabled after calling this function in order to update its scale and collision properties. The new scale is saved in the savegame.

elements.name: HasBeenPickedUp
elements.description: - returns true if the calling reference is currently inactive due to having been picked up by an actor or otherwise transferred to an inventory

elements.name: SetHasBeenPickedUp
elements.description: - toggles the flag that marks a reference as having been picked up by an actor. When called on a reference which was previously picked up, causes the reference to "respawn". Use

elements.name: GetRefCount
elements.description: - returns the number of items in a stack of items in the world.

elements.name: SetRefCount
elements.description: - sets the number of items in a stack of items in the world.

elements.name: SetBaseForm
elements.description: - changes the base object associated with a reference, with the limitation that the new base form must be of the same type as the old one (i.e. you can swap a weapon reference's base form only with another weapon). Does not work on actors or on items in containers. Use

elements.name: Activate2
elements.description: - like the existing Activate command, causes a reference to be activated. The only difference is that this command circumvents the limit on recursive scripted activations of an object, allowing unlimited repeated processing of the target's OnActivate script block. Use with care as performance may degrade if a large number of calls to this command occur within a single frame.

elements.name: IsRefDeleted
elements.description: - returns 1 if the passed object reference has been marked as deleted by a mod or the game. Deleted references should not be used in scripts.

elements.name: DeleteReference
elements.description: - attempts to delete the calling object from the game and returns true if successful. In order for a reference to be deleted, it must:

elements.name: GetBoundingBox
elements.description: - returns a stringmap representing the calling objects axis-aligned bounding box. This command only works for mobile objects (projectiles and actors). The stringmap returned contains two stringmaps: "center" has keys "x", "y", and "z" representing the coordinates of the center of the bounding box, and "extent" has the same keys representing the extent of the box along each axis. For example, the height of the box is equal to GetBoundingBox->extent->z * 2. Similarly the bottom of the box is equal to GetBoundingBox->center->z - GetBoundingBox->extent->z

elements.name: GetBoundingRadius
elements.description: - returns the radius of a sphere large enough to entirely contain the 3D geometry of the calling object.

elements.name: Update3D
elements.description: - updates the visual representation of the calling actor or object reference. This can be called immediately after commands like SetModelPath and SetEyes to make the changes visible and should work in any instance where instructions tell you to

elements.name: HasEffectShader
elements.description: - checks if the specified effect shader is playing on the calling reference, and if so returns the number of instances of that shader playing on it. Otherwise returns zero. Note that this command may return true for a short period after calling StopMagicShaderVisuals because the shader is not fully removed until its ending sequence has played out.

elements.name: IsInOblivion
elements.description: - returns 1 if the calling reference is in a cell or worldspace marked as belonging to the realm of Oblivion.

elements.name: GetSigilStoneUses
elements.description: - returns the number of uses for a sigil stone.

elements.name: SetSigilStoneUses
elements.description: - sets the number of uses for a sigil stone.

elements.name: ModSigilStoneUses
elements.description: - mods the number of uses for a sigil stone.

elements.name: GetPlayerSkillUse
elements.description: - returns the current experience towards the next level of the skill

elements.name: GetPlayerSkillUseC
elements.description: - alternatve version of GetPlayerSkillUse taking an actor value code for the skill

elements.name: IncrementPlayerSkillUse
elements.description: - records some additional uses of one of the skill actions

elements.name: GetSkillUseIncrement
elements.description: - gets the experience point increase for one use of a skill action

elements.name: SetSkillUseIncrement
elements.description: - sets the experience point increase for one use of a skill action

elements.name: IncrementPlayerSkillUseC
elements.description: - records some additional uses of one of the skill actions

elements.name: TriggerPlayerSkillUse
elements.description: - records positive or negative uses of one of the specified skill actions. Enough skill uses will increment or decrement the skill itself, and adjust the log of the number of increases for that skill.

elements.name: ModPlayerSkillExp
elements.description: - directly adjusts the experience for a skill. A large enough adjustment will increment or decrement the skill itself, and adjust the log of the number of increase for that skill.

elements.name: GetSkillUseIncrementC
elements.description: - gets the experience point increase for one use of a skill action

elements.name: SetSkillUseIncrementC
elements.description: - sets the experience point increase for one use of a skill action

elements.name: GetSkillGoverningAttribute
elements.description: - returns the governing attribute for the skill as an actor value code

elements.name: SetSkillGoverningAttribute
elements.description: - sets the governing attribute for the skill

elements.name: GetSkillGoverningAttributeC
elements.description: - alternate version of GetSkillGoverningAttribute taking an actor value code for the skill

elements.name: SetSkillGoverningAttributeC
elements.description: - alternate version of SetSkillGoverningAttribute taking actor value codes for the skill and attribute

elements.name: GetPlayerSkillAdvances
elements.description: - returns the number of times the skill level has advanced for that skill

elements.name: SetPlayerSkillAdvances
elements.description: - sets the number of times the skill has been advanced

elements.name: GetRequiredSkillExp
elements.description: - returns the total skill use required for the player to advance the specified skill. To get the

elements.name: GetRequiredSkillExpC
elements.description: - alternate version of GetRequiredSkillExp taking an actor value code for the skill.

elements.name: GetSkillSpecialization
elements.description: - returns the skill's specialization as an integer. 0: Combat, 1: Magic, or 2: Stealth.

elements.name: GetSkillSpecializationC
elements.description: - alternate version of GetSkillSpecialization taking an actor value code for the skill.

elements.name: SetSkillSpecialization
elements.description: - sets the skill's specialization as an integer. 0: Combat, 1: Magic, or 2: Stealth.

elements.name: SetSkillSpecializationC
elements.description: - alternate version of SetSkillSpecialization taking an actor value code for the skill

elements.name: ToggleSkillPerk
elements.description: - turns the perk associated with the specified skill at the specified mastery level on or off. Currently, this command only supports toggling the Journeyman Block perk. Support for additional perks and skills may be added in the future. The mastery level is an integer from 0 (Novice) to 4 (Master).

elements.name: GetSoulLevel
elements.description: - returns the soul level currently in the soul gem

elements.name: GetSoulGemCapacity
elements.description: - returns the max soul level the soul gem can contain

elements.name: SetSoulLevel
elements.description: - set the soul level of the soul gem

elements.name: SetSoulGemCapacity
elements.description: - set the capacity level of the soul gem

elements.name: GetCurrentSoulLevel
elements.description: - returns the current soul level of the calling actor reference

elements.name: GetSoundAttenuation
elements.description: - returns the specified attenuation value for the specified sound, where the attenuation is "max", "min", or "static"

elements.name: SetSoundAttenuation
elements.description: - sets the specified attenuation value for the specified sound, where the attenuation is "max", "min", or "static"

elements.name: GetSpellType
elements.description: - returns the spell type

elements.name: SetSpellType
elements.description: - sets the spell type

elements.name: GetSpellMagickaCost
elements.description: - returns the magicka casting cost according to the Oblivion formula. If called on a reference it will use the reference's magic skill values to determine the actual magicka cost of the spell. Without a reference it will return the base cost of the spell as reported in the CS.

elements.name: SetSpellMagickaCost
elements.description: - sets the magicka casting cost

elements.name: ModSpellMagickaCost
elements.description: - modifies the magicka casting cost up or down

elements.name: GetSpellMasteryLevel
elements.description: - returns the mastery level of the spell

elements.name: SetSpellMasteryLevel
elements.description: - sets the mastery level of the spell

elements.name: GetSpellSchool
elements.description: - returns the school of the spell, determined by the most expensive effect item

elements.name: GetSpellExplodesWithNoTarget
elements.description: - returns whether the touch spell explodes without a target

elements.name: SetSpellExplodesWithNoTarget
elements.description: - sets whether the touch spell will explode without a target

elements.name: IsSpellHostile
elements.description: - returns 1 if the spell is considered hostile

elements.name: SetSpellHostile
elements.description: - toggles whether or not a spell is considered hostile

elements.name: GetSpellPCStart
elements.description: - returns true if the PC Start flag is set for the specified spell

elements.name: GetSpellImmuneToSilence
elements.description: - returns true if the Immune to Silence flag is set for the specified spell

elements.name: GetSpellAreaEffectIgnoresLOS
elements.description: - returns true if the AE Ignores LOS flag is set for the specified spell

elements.name: GetSpellScriptEffectAlwaysApplies
elements.description: - returns true if the SEFF Always Applies flag is set for the specified spell

elements.name: GetSpellDisallowAbsorbReflect
elements.description: - returns true if the Disallow Absorb Reflect flag is set for the specified spell

elements.name: SetSpellPCStart
elements.description: - sets the PC Start flag for the specified spell

elements.name: SetSpellImmuneToSilence
elements.description: - sets the Immune to Silence flag for the specified spell

elements.name: SetSpellAreaEffectIgnoresLOS
elements.description: - sets the AE Ignores LOS flag for the specified spell

elements.name: SetSpellScriptEffectAlwaysApplies
elements.description: - sets the SEFF Always Applies flag for the specified spell

elements.name: SetSpellDisallowAbsorbReflect
elements.description: - sets the Disallow Absorb Reflect flag for the specified spell

elements.name: GetWeaponReach
elements.description: - returns the reach of the weapon

elements.name: SetWeaponReach
elements.description: - sets the reach of the weapon

elements.name: ModWeaponReach
elements.description: - modifies the reach of the weapon up or down

elements.name: GetWeaponType
elements.description: - retuns the weapon type

elements.name: SetWeaponType
elements.description: - sets the weapon type

elements.name: GetEquippedWeaponPoison
elements.description: - returns the poison applied to the equipped weapon. Called on the weapon holder.

elements.name: SetEquippedWeaponPoison
elements.description: - sets the poison applied to the equipped weapon and returns the previous poison.Called on the weapon holder.

elements.name: RemoveEquippedWeaponPoison
elements.description: - removes and returns the poison applied to the equipped weapon. Called on the weapon holder.

elements.name: GetCurrentWeatherID
elements.description: - returns the refID of the current weather

elements.name: GetWeatherOverride
elements.description: - returns the weather which is overriding the current weather as a result of the ForceWeather or SetWeather command with a non-zero "override" argument (for example, in the scripts which control weather near Oblivion gates), or zero if the weather is not being overridden.

elements.name: GetWeatherWindSpeed
elements.description: - returns the wind speed of the specified weather

elements.name: SetWeatherWindSpeed
elements.description: - sets the wind speed of the specified weather

elements.name: GetWeatherCloudSpeedLower
elements.description: - returns the speed of the lower cloud layer

elements.name: SetWeatherCloudSpeedLower
elements.description: - sets the speed of the lower cloud layer

elements.name: GetWeatherCloudSpeedUpper
elements.description: - returns the speed of the upper cloud layer

elements.name: SetWeatherCloudSpeedUpper
elements.description: - sets the speed of the upper cloud layer

elements.name: GetWeatherTransDelta
elements.description: - returns the transition delta of the weather

elements.name: SetWeatherTransDelta
elements.description: - sets the transition delta of the weather

elements.name: GetWeatherSunGlare
elements.description: - returns the sun glare

elements.name: SetWeatherSunGlare
elements.description: - sets the sun glare

elements.name: GetWeatherSunDamage
elements.description: - returns the sun damage

elements.name: SetWeatherSunDamage
elements.description: - sets the sun damage

elements.name: GetWeatherFogDayNear
elements.description: - returns the daytime near fog distance

elements.name: SetWeatherFogDayNear
elements.description: - sets the daytime near fog distance

elements.name: GetWeatherFogDayFar
elements.description: - returns the daytime far fog distance

elements.name: SetWeatherFogDayFar
elements.description: - sets the daytime far fog distance

elements.name: GetWeatherFogNightNear
elements.description: - returns the nighttime near fog distance

elements.name: SetWeatherFogNightNear
elements.description: - sets the nighttime near fog distance

elements.name: GetWeatherFogNightFar
elements.description: - returns the nighttime far fog distance

elements.name: SetWeatherFogNightFar
elements.description: - sets the nighttime far fog distance

elements.name: GetWeatherHDRValue
elements.description: - returns the specified HDR value for the weather

elements.name: SetWeatherHDRValue
elements.description: - sets the specified HDR value for the weather

elements.name: GetWeatherColor
elements.description: - returns the red, green or blue value of the specified weather color at the specified weather time

elements.name: SetWeatherColor
elements.description: - sets the red, green and blue values for the specified weather color at the specified weather time
example: (nothing) SetWeatherColor red:int green:int blue:int whichColor:int weather:ref whichTime:int

elements.name: GetWeatherLightningFrequency
elements.description: - returns the frequency of the lightning

elements.name: SetWeatherLightningFrequency
elements.description: - sets the frequency of the lightning

elements.name: GetWeatherClassification
elements.description: - returns the precipitation

elements.name: IsDoor
elements.description: - returns whether the calling reference or passed objectID is a door

elements.name: IsFurniture
elements.description: - returns whether the calling reference or passed objectID is furniture

elements.name: IsActivator
elements.description: - returns whether the calling reference or passed objectID is an activator

elements.name: GetGameLoaded
elements.description: - returns 1 if a saved game was loaded or a new game was started since the last time this call was made. This command returns true once per game load/start for each script that uses it.

elements.name: GetGameRestarted
elements.description: - returns 1 if Oblivion was exited and restarted since the last time this call was made from the calling script. Use this condition to reset or undo changes made by OBSE functions which are not stored in the savegame.

elements.name: GetOBSEVersion
elements.description: - returns the version number of OBSE

elements.name: GetOBSERevision
elements.description: - returns the minor version number of OBSE. For instance, when running the second released version of v0014, this function returns 2.

elements.name: SetNumericGameSetting
elements.description: - sets the specified game setting to the following variable or direct value

elements.name: GetStringGameSetting
elements.description: - returns the string value of a game setting

elements.name: SetStringGameSettingEX
elements.description: - sets the string value of a game setting. The new string value is contained within the format string, following the setting name and separated by a pipe character, i.e.

elements.name: GetNumericINISetting
elements.description: - returns the specified ini setting

elements.name: SetNumericINISetting
elements.description: - sets the specified ini setting to the following variable or direct value

elements.name: GetStringINISetting
elements.description: - returns the value of a string ini setting

elements.name: SetStringINISetting
elements.description: - sets the ini setting to the specified string. Pass both arguments as a single string of the format "settingName|newValue". If called from the console, use the "@" character in place of the pipe character.

elements.name: GetFPS
elements.description: - returns the frames per second of the game

elements.name: IsThirdPerson
elements.description: - returns whether the point of view is 3rd person or not

elements.name: IsGlobalCollisionDisabled
elements.description: - returns whether collision is disabled

elements.name: SetDisableGlobalCollision
elements.description: - sets whether to disable the global collision or not

elements.name: RunBatchScript
elements.description: - runs a specified text file under the Oblivion directory as a script. Works the same as the console function

elements.name: IsPluginInstalled
elements.description: - returns whether a given plugin is installed

elements.name: GetPluginVersion
elements.description: - returns the version of the specified plugin

elements.name: GetDebugSelection
elements.description: - returns the reference to the item last selected in the console

elements.name: GetSoundPlaying
elements.description: - If no parameters are passed, then it dumps a list of the currently playing sounds and actors making sound to obse.log (this may change). If a string is passed, then it returns the number of times the specified sound is playing. The string may contain wildcards:

elements.name: RunScriptLine
elements.description: - runs a line of script as if it were called from the console. If bRunOnRef is 1, the line of script will be executed on the calling object, if any. If bSuppressOutput is true, no output will be generated in the console while the script line is executing.
example: (nothing) reference.RunScriptLine formatString:string var1 var2 ... var20 bRunOnRef:bool bSuppressOutput:bool

elements.name: GetFormFromMod
elements.description: - attempts to look up and return a form defined in another mod, prepending the two-digit mod index to the formID. The formID is passed in hexadecimal format, i.e. 0001A46B. The first two digits of the formID are ignored and can be omitted. The file name must include the file extension. Pass "NONE" as the file name to look up a dynamic form in the saved game (mod index 0xFF, for example cloned forms).

elements.name: ToggleFirstPerson
elements.description: - toggles the player's POV to first or third person. Passing 1 enables first person view, 0 enables third person.

elements.name: GetLastCreatedSpell
elements.description: - returns the spell most recently created by the player during the current game session

elements.name: GetLastEnchantedItem
elements.description: - returns the enchanted item most recently created by the player during the current game session

elements.name: GetLastCreatedPotion
elements.description: - returns the potion most recently created by the player during the current game session

elements.name: GetLastUniqueCreatedPotion
elements.description: - returns the last

elements.name: IsConsoleOpen
elements.description: - returns 1 if the console is currently open

elements.name: LoadGameEx
elements.description: - attempts to load the saved game with the specified name

elements.name: ActorValueToString
elements.description: - converts an actor value to its localized name

elements.name: ActorValueToStringC
elements.description: - converts an

elements.name: StringToActorValue
elements.description: - converts the name of an actor value into the actor value code itself

elements.name: GetEditorID
elements.description: - attempts to retrieve the editorID for the specified object. EditorIDs for most forms are not loaded at run-time. Currently this function only returns editor IDs for cells and quests - for other types, returns the formID as a string. If the second argument is non-zero, however, returns an empty string instead of the formID.

elements.name: GetEditorID2
elements.description: - attempts to retrieve the editorID for the specified object. If REID is installed it interrogate it's Interface (TODO more plugins management).

elements.name: GetFormIDString
elements.description: - returns the formID of the specified object as a hexadecimal string. If the object cannot be found in memory (for example, a non-persistent reference), returns "00000000"

elements.name: GetRawFormIDString
elements.description: (GetFormIDString2) - returns the formID stored in an array element or ref variable as a hexadecimal string. Unlike GetFormIDString, this command does not care if  the formID is valid.

elements.name: GetUserTime
elements.description: - returns a StringMap containing information about the time and date on the player's system

elements.name: ActorValueToCode
elements.description: - given an actor value name, returns the corresponding

elements.name: GetGameDifficulty
elements.description: - returns the current difficulty level of the game as a float from -1.0 to 1.0, with higher values corresponding to greater difficulty.

elements.name: SetGameDifficulty
elements.description: - sets the current difficulty level of the game as a float from -1.0 to 1.0, with higher values corresponding to greater difficulty. Values outside of the valid range are ignored.

elements.name: GetOblivionDirectory
elements.description: - returns the full path to the user's Oblivion install

elements.name: GetWaterShader
elements.description: - returns information about the current water shader given a string representing one of the water shader properties. Supports the same property names as the ModWaterShader console command: "direction", "velocity", "frequency", "amplitude", "fresnel", "reflectivity", "opacity", "blend", "scrollx", "scrolly", "rainforce", "rainvelocity", "rainfalloff", "rainsize", "displaceforce", "displacevelocity", "displacefalloff", and "displacedampener".

elements.name: GetGridsToLoad
elements.description: - returns the effective value of the uGridsToLoad ini setting. This value is specified in Oblivion.ini but adjusted by the game during play.

elements.name: SetOLMPGrids
elements.description: - specifies the number of grids that a call to OutputLocalMapPicturesOverride should use when generating local map pictures. The value passed in must be smaller than the effective value of the uGridsToLoad ini setting, which can be obtained with GetGridsToLoad. All subsequent calls to OutputLocalMapPicturesOverride will use the new value.

elements.name: OutputLocalMapPicturesOverride
elements.description: - this command is identical to the console command OutputLocalMapPictures, except it uses the number of grids specified by the last call to SetOLMPGrids when generating the maps.

elements.name: GetWorldSpaceParentWorldSpace
elements.description: - returns a worldspace's parent worldspace

elements.name: GlobalVariableExists
elements.description: - returns 1 if a global variable exists with the specified editorID

elements.name: GetCellChanged
elements.description: -returns 1 if the player has entered a new cell since the last time the command was called from the calling script, including transitioning from one exterior cell to another.

elements.name: ResolveModIndex
elements.description: - Attempts to resolve a mod index which was stored during a previous game session to account for any changes to the user's load order. Given the stored mod index for a mod, returns the mod index currently associated with that same mod, or -1 if the index could not be resolved (for instance, because the mod is no longer loaded).

elements.name: SetCameraFOV2
elements.description: - Set Camera FOV without constraints.

elements.name: GetLoadedTypeArray
elements.description: - Return an array with all Loaded form of type and optionally with specific mod index.

elements.name: CloneForm
elements.description: - creates and returns a new base object that is an exact copy of the passed objectID

elements.name: IsClonedForm
elements.description: - returns whether the passed objectID is a cloned form or not. A cloned form is saved as part of the save game. Instances of cloned forms are player created potions, spells and enchanted items

elements.name: Label
elements.description: - save the location of the command following the

elements.name: Goto
elements.description: - jump to a previously saved location

elements.name: While
elements.description: - evaluates an OBSE expression. If the expression is true, the statements following it will be executed until the next

elements.name: Loop
elements.description: - Returns execution to the most recent

elements.name: Break
elements.description: - Must be called inside of a

elements.name: Continue
elements.description: - Must be called inside of a

elements.name: GetFirstRef
elements.description: - returns the first reference in the current cell. A type can optionally be supplied to return only references matching that type. Additionally, you can pass 69 for actors and 70 for inventory items. This function should only be used either within a

elements.name: GetNextRef
elements.description: - returns the next reference in the curent cell.

elements.name: GetNumRefs
elements.description: - returns the number of references in the current cell which match the optionally supplied type code. Use 69 for actors and 70 for inventory items. An optional cell depth can be specified for exteriors. By default, inactive references to items which were previously picked up by an actor are ignored; passing 1 for the third parameter will force those references to be included.

elements.name: GetFirstRefInCell
elements.description: - Works the same as

elements.name: GetNumRefsInCell
elements.description: - Works the same as

elements.name: GetHighActors
elements.description: - returns an Array containing all actors currently in high AI processing. Generally this is equivalent to all the actors in the currently loaded interior cell or set of exterior cells adjacent to and including the player's current cell. This command is more efficient than using GetFirst/NextRef.

elements.name: GetMiddleHighActors
elements.description: - returns an Array containing all actors currently in middle high AI processing. This generally includes all actors in cells that are not currently loaded but which have recently been visited by the player. This command is more efficient than using GetFirst/NextRef.

elements.name: GetLowActors
elements.description: - returns an Array containing all actors currently in low AI processing. This generally includes actors on unloaded cells. This command is more efficient than using GetFirst/NextRef.

elements.name: IsKeyPressed
elements.description: - returns whether the specified key is currently pressed. Uses standard windows key codes.

elements.name: IsKeyPressed2
elements.description: - returns whether the specified key is currently pressed. Uses DX scancodes. Detect Tapped/Hold/Hammered keys but not Disabled keys

elements.name: GetKeyPress
elements.description: - returns the DX scan code of the key being pressed. If more than one key is pressed use whichIndex to choose which keycode to return.

elements.name: GetNumKeysPressed
elements.description: - returns the number of keys currently pressed

elements.name: DisableKey
elements.description: - disables the key with the specified dx scancode

elements.name: EnableKey
elements.description: - enables the key with the specified dx scancode. Turns off DisableKey.

elements.name: HoldKey
elements.description: - holds down the key with the specified dx scancode

elements.name: ReleaseKey
elements.description: - releases a held key with the specified dx scancode

elements.name: TapKey
elements.description: - presses the key with the specidied dx scancode once

elements.name: HammerKey
elements.description: - fakes keypresses every other frame of the key with the specified dx scancode

elements.name: AHammerKey
elements.description: - fakes keypresses every other frame on the alternate frames from HammerKey of the key with the specified dx scancode

elements.name: UnHammerKey
elements.description: - stops hammering the key with the specified dx scancode

elements.name: GetControl
elements.description: - returns the dx scancode of the key used for the specified control

elements.name: GetAltControl2
elements.description: - returns the dx scancode of the alternate key used for the specified control. Unlike GetAltControl, the return value of this function is a valid DX scan code which requires no further calculation for use with other input functions.

elements.name: GetMouseButtonPress
elements.description: - returns the dx scancode of the mouse button being pressed. If more than one mouse button is pressed, use whichIndex to choose which code to return

elements.name: GetNumMouseButtonsPressed
elements.description: - returns the number of mouse buttons pressed

elements.name: DisableMouse
elements.description: - prevents the mouse from moving

elements.name: EnableMouse
elements.description: - turns off

elements.name: MoveMouseX
elements.description: - moves the mouse horizontally the specified number of pixels

elements.name: MoveMouseY
elements.description: - moves the mouse veritcally the specified number of pixels

elements.name: SetMouseSpeedX
elements.description: - moves the mouse in the horizontal axis at the specified number of pixels per second

elements.name: SetMouseSpeedY
elements.description: - moves the mouse in the vertical axis at the specified number of pixels per second

elements.name: IsKeyPressed3
elements.description: - returns 1 if the key or mouse button specified is currently pressed. Just like IsKeyPressed2, but detects disabled keys.

elements.name: IsControlPressed
elements.description: - returns 1 if either the key or mouse button assigned to the specified control code is currently pressed. Detects disabled keys.

elements.name: DisableControl
elements.description: - disables both the key and mouse buton assigned to the specified control

elements.name: EnableControl
elements.description: - enables the key and mouse button for a control disabled with

elements.name: OnKeyDown
elements.description: - registers a script as a listener for input events. Returns 1 for one frame when the passed key or mouse button is pressed. If used by multiple scripts, each script will be informed of the key's state. Will not return true again until the key is released and then pressed again.

elements.name: OnControlDown
elements.description: - works like

elements.name: TapControl
elements.description: - presses the key or mouse button associated with the specified control once

elements.name: SetControl
elements.description: - assigns a new key to the specified control. If the specified control already has a key assigned, the key mappings are swapped.

elements.name: SetAltControl2
elements.description: - assigns a new mouse button to the specified control. If the specified control already has a mouse button assigned, the button mappings are swapped.

elements.name: GetCursorPos
elements.description: - returns the current X or Y coordinate of the mouse cursor in menu mode. Minumum coordinate is zero, maximum is determined by the user's screen resolution. Specify 'X' or 'Y' for the axis.

elements.name: SetIsControl
elements.description: - allows mods to register or unregister keys or mouse buttons as custom controls. Other mods can then use

elements.name: IsControl
elements.description: - returns 1 if the specified key or mouse button is assigned to a game control, 2 if it has been registered as a custom control by a mod via

elements.name: IsKeyDisabled
elements.description: - returns 1 if the key has been disabled using

elements.name: IsControlDisabled
elements.description: - returns 1 if thecontrol has been disabled by a call to

elements.name: GetMouseButtonsSwapped
elements.description: - returns true if the user has configured his operating system to swap the left and right mouse buttons. Input functions respect the swap configuration.

elements.name: Abs
elements.description: - returns the absolute value of the argument

elements.name: Ceil
elements.description: - returns the nearest whole number above the argument

elements.name: Exp
elements.description: - returns e to the power of the argument

elements.name: Floor
elements.description: - returns the nearest whole number less than the argument

elements.name: Log
elements.description: - returns the natural logarithm of the number

elements.name: Log10
elements.description: - returns the base 10 logarithm of the number

elements.name: Pow
elements.description: - returns the base raised to the exponents power

elements.name: Rand
elements.description: - returns a random number between min and max

elements.name: SquareRoot
elements.description: - returns the square root of the argument

elements.name: Fmod
elements.description: - returns the floating point modulus of dividend in the given base. This differs from

elements.name: ACos
elements.description: - returns the arccosine of the argument.

elements.name: ASin
elements.description: - returns the arcsine of the argument.

elements.name: ATan
elements.description: - returns the arctangent of the argument.

elements.name: ATan2
elements.description: - returns the arctangent of the arguments.

elements.name: Cos
elements.description: - returns the cosine of the angle.

elements.name: Cosh
elements.description: - returns the hyperbolic cosine of the angle.

elements.name: Sin
elements.description: - returns the sine of the angle.

elements.name: Sinh
elements.description: - returns the hyperbolic sine of the angle.

elements.name: Tan
elements.description: - returns the tangent of the angle.

elements.name: Tanh
elements.description: - returns the hyperbolic tangent of the angle.

elements.name: LeftShift
elements.description: - shifts the argument left by the specified number of bits. Returns zero if shiftAmount is >= 32.

elements.name: RightShift
elements.description: - shifts the argument right by the specified number of bits, inserting zeros on the left. Returns zero if shiftAmount is >= 32.

elements.name: LogicalAnd
elements.description: - returns the bitwise AND of the two arguments

elements.name: LogicalOr
elements.description: - returns the bitwise OR of the two arguments

elements.name: LogicalXor
elements.description: - returns the bitwise XOR of the two arguments

elements.name: LogicalNot
elements.description: - returns the bitwise NOT of the argument

elements.name: GenerateZeroMatrix
elements.description: - Returns an nm matrix with each element filled with a 0.

elements.name: GenerateIdentityMatrix
elements.description: - Returns a square (nn) matrix with each element along the diagonal (from top-left to bottom-right) filled with a 1, and every other element with 0.

elements.name: GenerateRotationMatrix
elements.description: - Returns a 33 square matrix that can serve as a

elements.name: VectorMagnitude
elements.description: - Returns the magnitude of a vector (square-root of the sum of the squares of its elements).

elements.name: VectorNormalize
elements.description: - Returns the normalized version of a vector (each entry of the vector divided by its magnitude). A normalized vector has a magnitude of 1.

elements.name: VectorDot
elements.description: - Returns the

elements.name: VectorCross
elements.description: - Returns the

elements.name: ForceRowVector
elements.description: - Takes a one-dimensional array, and returns an equivalent two-dimensional array, where the outer array's only element is the 1d array; i.e.

elements.name: ForceColumnVector
elements.description: - Takes a one-dimensional array, and returns an equivalent two-dimensional array, where the outer array's elements are each arrays with only one element - each element in the 1d array. I.e.,

elements.name: MatrixTrace
elements.description: - Returns the

elements.name: MatrixDeterminant
elements.description: - Returns the

elements.name: MatrixRREF
elements.description: - Returns the

elements.name: MatrixInvert
elements.description: - Returns the

elements.name: MatrixTranspose
elements.description: - Returns the

elements.name: MatrixScale
elements.description: - Returns a matrix scaled by a number, that is, with every element multiplied by that number.

elements.name: MatrixAdd
elements.description: - Returns the sum of two matrices, that is, a matrix where each element is the sum of the elements in the corresponding position in each of the addends. The two matrices must have the same dimensions.

elements.name: MatrixSubtract
elements.description: - Returns the difference of two matrices, that is, a matrix where each element is the difference between the elements in the corresponding position in the terms. The two matrices must have the same dimensions.

elements.name: MatrixMultiply
elements.description: - Returns the product of two matrices using

elements.name: MessageEX
elements.description: - prints a formatted message using the extended
example: (nothing) MessageEX formatString:string var1 var2 ... var20 duration:int

elements.name: MessageBoxEX
elements.description:
- 
displays a formatted messagebox using the extended

elements.name: PrintToConsole
elements.description: - prints a formatted message to the console using the extended

elements.name: SetMessageSound
elements.description: - sets the sound which is to be played by the next call to

elements.name: SetMessageIcon
elements.description: - sets the icon which is to be displayed to the left of the text for the next call to

elements.name: DebugPrint
elements.description: - prints a message to the console only if debug mode has been enabled for the mod from which the calling script originates. Use

elements.name: SetDebugMode
elements.description: - toggles all debug messages on or off for the mod from which the calling script originates. Pass 1 as the argument to turn debug messages on, or 0 to turn them off. Optionally pass the modIndex of the mod for which you wish to toggle messages.

elements.name: Print
elements.description: - prints a string expression to the console. This is mainly a convenience function to eliminate the need for temporary string variables when printing complex strings using

elements.name: PrintD
elements.description: - as

elements.name: GetModIndex
elements.description: - returns the mod index of the specified plugin. This is equivalent to the first two digits of the object's formID (when represented in hexadecimal notation).

elements.name: GetSourceModIndex
elements.description: - returns the mod index of the plugin from which the specified object originates

elements.name: GetNumLoadedMods
elements.description: - returns the number of plugins currently loaded. Used in conjunction with GetModIndex, this can be used to verify load order at run-time.

elements.name: IsModLoaded
elements.description: - returns 1 if the specified .esp or .esm is currently loaded. String is case-insensitive but must include the file extension.

elements.name: GetNthModName
elements.description: - returns the filename of the nth loaded mod

elements.name: SetModLocalData
elements.description: - sets the data value associated with the specified key for the mod to which the calling script belongs. The key must be a string; the data can be a string, number, or object. Keys are case-insensitive and unique - only one data value can be associated with a particular key.

elements.name: GetModLocalData
elements.description: - gets the data value associated with the specified key for the mod to which the calling script belongs. If no data exists for the key, returns 0.

elements.name: ModLocalDataExists
elements.description: - returns true if local data exists with the specified key for the mod to which the calling script belongs.

elements.name: RemoveModLocalData
elements.description: - removes the data value associated with the specified key for the mod to which the calling script belongs. If no data exists for the key, returns false, otherwise returns true.

elements.name: GetAllModLocalData
elements.description: - returns a StringMap consisting of all of the name-value entries for the mod local data associated with the mod to which the calling script belongs. This is a copy of the local data so modifying the array contents will not modify the stored data.

elements.name: GetHotkeyItem
elements.description: - returns the item or spell bound to the specified hotkey (1-8)

elements.name: SetHotkeyItem
elements.description: - sets a hotkey to the specified spell or item

elements.name: ClearHotkey
elements.description: - removes any spell or item bound to the specified hotkey

elements.name: FileExists
elements.description: - returns 1 if the specified file exists in the user's installation folder or within one of the BSA archives. Path is relative to the user's install folder, which is "Bethesda SoftworksOblivion" by default.

elements.name: GetActiveMenuMode
elements.description: - returns the

elements.name: GetActiveMenuSelection
elements.description: - returns the item in the active menu over which the mouse is currently positioned

elements.name: GetActiveMenuFilter
elements.description: - returns the

elements.name: GetActiveMenuRef
elements.description: - returns the reference from which the active menu is derived

elements.name: GetActiveMenuObject
elements.description: - returns the base object from which the active menu is derived

elements.name: GetEnchMenuSoulgem
elements.description: - returns the soulgem selected for enchantment in the enchantment menu. Only works if the enchantment menu is the active menu.

elements.name: GetEnchMenuEnchItem
elements.description: - returns the enchantment which is to be applied to the item to be enchanted. Only works if the enchantment menu is the active menu.

elements.name: IsBarterMenuActive
elements.description: - returns 1 if the player is bartering with a merchant, providing a way to distinguish between an ordinary container menu and a barter menu, which both return the same MenuMode code

elements.name: GetAlchMenuIngredient
elements.description: - returns one of the four ingredients, from 0 to 3, selected for inclusion in the potion currently being brewed

elements.name: GetAlchMenuIngredientCount
elements.description: - returns the number of the specified ingredient selected for inclusion in the potion being brewed. Pass 0 for the first ingredient, 3 for the last.

elements.name: GetAlchMenuApparatus
elements.description: - returns the apparatus object being used in the brewing process

elements.name: CloseAllMenus
elements.description: - closes all currently open menus. Note: if the console is open at the time this function is called, it will be closed but the displayed console text will remain visible until the console is opened and closed again.

elements.name: GetContainerMenuView
elements.description: - when the container/barter menu is open, returns 1 if the player is viewing his own inventory, or 0 if viewing the container or merchant's inventory

elements.name: SetButtonPressed
elements.description: - When any Message menu is displayed (game prompts such as the inventory quantity prompt as well as those created by the

elements.name: IsGameMessageBox
elements.description: - returns 1 if a messagebox is currently displayed which was generated by game code (e.g., confirm item purchase) rather than a script

elements.name: GetMessageBoxType
elements.description: - returns a code indicating the origin of the currently-displayed messagebox

elements.name: GetMenuFloatValue
elements.description: - returns the value of a float or boolean trait of the specified menu

elements.name: GetMenuStringValue
elements.description: - returns the value of a string trait of the specified menu

elements.name: SetMenuFloatValue
elements.description: - sets the value of a float or boolean trait of the specified menu

elements.name: SetMenuStringValue
elements.description: - sets the value of a string trait of the specified menu. The new value follows the trait name, separated from it by a pipe character. i.e. "elementName	raitName|newValue". (If calling from the console, replace the pipe character with the '@' character).

elements.name: GetActiveUIComponentID
elements.description: - returns the integer ID of the menu elemented currently highlighted by the mouse cursor as defined by that element's <id> trait in the menu XML file.

elements.name: GetActiveUIComponentName
elements.description: - returns the name of the menu element currently highlighted by the mouse cursor as defined in the menu XML file.

elements.name: GetActiveUIComponentFullName
elements.description: - like GetActiveUIComponentName, returns the name of the menu element currently highlighted by the mouse cursor, if any. However the returned name is fully qualified with the names of the element's parents in a form suitable to pass to commands like GetMenuFloatValue. i.e., if button_1 is highlighted in the MessageMenu, this command returns "background utton_1".

elements.name: ClickMenuButton
elements.description: - simulates the user clicking on the specified UI component. Pass the fully qualified component name as described above, or pass the <id> trait of the desired component as specified in the XML, preceded by a '#'; i.e. "

elements.name: GetMenuHasTrait
elements.description: - returns 1 if the menu has the trait specified. The trait name may be qualified with component names to access traits of subcomponents.

elements.name: GetTileChildren
elements.description: - given a UI component (referred to by the game as a "Tile"), returns an Array containing the names of all of the direct subcomponents of that component. Using this command is more efficient than accessing children individually if you need to inspect more than one subcomponent.

elements.name: GetTileTraits
elements.description: - given a UI component, returns a StringMap representing all of that component's traits and their values. The keys of the returned StringMap's elements are the names of the traits; their values are the string or numeric values of the traits. This command is more efficient for accessing multiple traits of the same component than the commands which access traits individually.

elements.name: PrintTileInfo
elements.description: - a debugging command which outputs all of the children of a UI component as well as the names and values of all of its traits. Output is sent to the console and to obse.log. Avoid using this function in released mods; it is intended for testing and debugging only.

elements.name: PrintActiveTileInfo
elements.description: - a debugging command which outputs all of the children of the UI component currently under the mouse cursor as well as the names and values of all of its traits. Output is sent to the console and to obse.log. Avoid using this function in released mods; it is intended for testing and debugging only.

elements.name: GetMapMenuMarkerName
elements.description: - when the world map menu is visible and a location icon is highlighted by the mouse, this command returns the name of the highlighted icon. At all other times it returns an empty string.

elements.name: GetMapMenuMarkerRef
elements.description: - when the world map menu is visible and a location icon is highlighted by the mouse, this command returns a reference to the MapMarker reference associated with the highlighted icon. This is a slow function, so avoid calling it repeatedly. If you want to detect changes in the currently highlighted map icon, it is best to check GetMapMenuMarkerName over the course of several frames, and only call GetMapMenuMarkerRef if the name changes and is not an empty string.

elements.name: GetBarterItem
elements.description: - returns the active item in a container menu

elements.name: GetBarterItemQuantity
elements.description: - returns the selected quantity of the active item in a container menu

elements.name: GetLastTransactionItem
elements.description: - returns the item most recently confirmed for buying or selling by the player. Note that this transaction may not have been completed due to the purchaser having insufficient gold or attempting to sell a quest item. Use

elements.name: GetLastTransactionQuantity
elements.description: - returns the quantity of the most recent buy/sell transaction confirmed by the player. Note that the transaction may not have been completed due to the purchaser having insufficient gold or attempting to sell a quest item. Use

elements.name: GetTransactionInfo
elements.description: - returns information about the most recent barter transaction completed by the player as a Stringmap. Specify "buy" for information about the player's most recent purchase, or "sell" for his most recent sale to a merchant. Once a transaction has been returned to a particular script, subsequent calls to this function requesting the same type of transaction ("buy" or "sell") will return zero until a new transaction of that type takes place. The returned Stringmap contains the following information:

elements.name: GetQMCurrent (GetQuantityMenuCurrentQuantity)
elements.description: - returns the current quantity in the quantity menu

elements.name: GetQMMaximum (GetQuantityMenuMaximumQuantity)
elements.description: - returns the maximum quantity in the quantity menu

elements.name: GetQMItem (GetQuantityMenuItem)
elements.description: - returns the active item in the quantity menu

elements.name: GetClassMenuSelectedClass
elements.description: - while the class selection menu is visible, returns the class which would be selected by the player if he were to click 'Done'.

elements.name: GetClassMenuHighlightedClass
elements.description: - while the class selection menu is visible, returns the class over which the cursor is currently positioned, if any.

elements.name: GetEnchMenuBaseItem
elements.description: - while the enchantment menu is visible, returns the unenchanted item selected by the player as the target of the enchantment.

elements.name: UpdateContainerMenu
elements.description: - if called while a container or barter menu is displayed, updates the contents of the menu. In barter mode this recalculates prices and quantities of available items.

elements.name: UpdateSpellPurchaseMenu
elements.description: - when called while the spell purchase menu is visible, updates the contents of the menu to reflect changes in prices

elements.name: OpenTextInput
elements.description: - opens a text input menu if one is not currently in use. MenuType is 0 for a messagebox, 1 for a book, or 2 for a scroll. The MaxLength parameter specifies how many characters to allow the user to enter. For messageboxes, the prompt string will be displayed before the cursor and cannot be erased. It may also contain buttons, with the button text separated from the prompt text with pipe '|' characters as in
example: (nothing) OpenTextInput promptString:string var1 var2 ... var20 menuType:int maxLength:int

elements.name: IsTextInputInUse
elements.description: - returns 1 if a script is currently using a text input menu, regardless of whether or not the menu is visible. Only one script may request text input at a time.

elements.name: GetInputText
elements.description: - returns the text entered by the user. You may call this function at any point before calling

elements.name: UpdateTextInput
